d3776ca0a21645c1659f58db70f28b10109b9f41.title: SYSTEM AND METHOD OF NANOCARBON MATERIALS MANUFACTURING BY PULSE ELECTRIC DISCHARGE IN LIQUID
d3776ca0a21645c1659f58db70f28b10109b9f41.abstract: A system for manufacturing a nanomaterial may include a first electrode; a second electrode spaced apart from the first electrode by a gap; and a chamber configured to enclose the first electrode, the second electrode, and a liquid. The system may also include a power supply configured to provide electrical energy to at least one of the first electrode and the second electrode; and a pump configured to cause the liquid to flow through the gap between the first electrode and the second electrode.

98e34964f4b73a7c95c29fe458c78f3562afa5cc.title: DISPOSITIF DE COMMANDE POUR MACHINE D'ÉLECTROÉROSION PAR FIL ET PROCÉDÉ DE COMMANDE POUR USINAGE PAR ÉLECTROÉROSION PAR FIL
98e34964f4b73a7c95c29fe458c78f3562afa5cc.abstract: This control device for a wire electric discharge machine includes: a movement control unit that causes a wire electrode to move along a machining path; a voltage control unit that controls a machining power supply and applies a machining voltage across poles; and a machining control unit that maintains a non-discharge state in which discharge does not occur between the poles until the wire electrode reaches a first position on the machining path, that, upon the wire electrode reaching the first position, gradually increases the discharge density so that the discharge density of the discharge becomes a set value set as a machining condition, and that, upon the wire electrode reaching the first position again, gradually decreases the discharge density to achieve a non-discharge state.

ed64604432a5ebaa18266ab6f217356d465a10cb.title: Electric discharge machine for precision process
ed64604432a5ebaa18266ab6f217356d465a10cb.abstract: 본 발명은 전극의 세팅시간을 줄이고 작업능률을 향상시킬 수 있는 정밀 세팅 및 가공을 포함하는 정밀 가공용 방전 가공기에 관한 것으로서, 상측의 헤드부(100)와 하측의 거치부(200)로 구분하면서 헤드부(100)와 거치부(200) 사이가 개방된 형태로 형성된 본체부, 상기 본체부에 구비되며 피가공물(20)이 거치되는 거치부(200), 상기 거치부(200)의 상면에 돌출 형성되어 상기 피가공물(20)이 지지되며 전류가 흐르는 음극전극부, 상기 거치부(200)의 상면을 마주하도록 배치되며 전류가 흐르는 양극전극부(180) 및, 상기 양극전극부(180)를 고정하면서 높이 및 좌우이동을 제어하는 지그이동부(100a)를 구성하며, 상기 지그이동부(100a)는, 동력부(110)와 상기 동력부(110) 하측에 위치한 높이조절부(120)와 상기 높이조절부(120) 하측에 위치한 연결체(140)와 상기 연결체(140) 하측에 위치한 지그회전체(150)와 상기 지그회전체(150)의 하측에 위치한 전극지그(160)와 상기 전극지그(160) 하측에 위치한 소정의 수직길이로 형성된 전극(170)과 상기 전극(170)의 하측에 위치하여 피가공물의 가공부위에 접촉하는 제1전극팁(183)으로 구성된 양극전극부(180)를 포함하며, 상기 양극전극부(180)는, 전극(170) 하단에 연결되는 수직형 제1몸체(181-1)와 상기 제1몸체(181-1)의 일측면 하단에서 수평으로 연결되면서 상면 중앙에서 하면 중앙으로 관통된 제1체결공(181-3)이 형성된 제2몸체(181-2)로 구성된 제1지지부(181)와, 상기 제1지지부(181)의 제2몸체(181-2) 하부에 배치되어 제1체결공(181-3)의 위치에 대응된 제2체결공(182-1)이 형성되면서 하면 중앙에 제1전극팁(183)의 상부를 결속하는 제1삽입공이 형성된 전극연결체(182)를 포함하는 것을 특징으로 한다.

51c2fea6821d728ecbb3a6f94734f6be6f74a49b.title: Electric discharge machining system for precision setting and process
51c2fea6821d728ecbb3a6f94734f6be6f74a49b.abstract: 본 발명은 전극의 세팅시간을 줄이고 작업능률을 향상시킬 수 있는 정밀 세팅 및 가공을 포함하는 방전 가공 시스템에 관한 것으로서, 외관을 형성하는 본체부, 상기 본체부에 구비되며 피가공물이 거치되는 거치부(200), 상기 거치부(200)의 상면에 돌출 형성되어 상기 피가공물이 지지되며 전류가 흐르는 음극전극부, 상기 거치부(200)의 상면을 마주하도록 배치되며 전류가 흐르는 양극전극부(180), 상기 양극전극부(180)를 고정하면서 높이 및 좌우이동을 제어하는 지그이동부(100a) 및, 상기 피가공물의 방전가공을 제어하는 방전제어모듈을 포함하는 방전가공기가 구비되며, 상기 방전제어모듈은, 피가공물의 3D 도면을 이용하여 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공을 자동으로 수행하는 방전가공프로그램과, 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공시 상기 방전가공기에 설치된 센서들의 측정값을 화면에 표시하고 동작 상태를 실시간으로 화면에 표시하는 모니터와, 상기 방전가공기의 동작을 제어하는 신호를 입력하는 동작스위치 입력부와, 상기 방전가공프로그램을 저장하고, 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공 측정값을 시간대별로 저장하는 메모리 및, 상기 동작스위치 입력부의 입력 신호와 상기 방전가공프로그램에 따라 방전 가공을 자동 수행을 제어하는 제어부로 구성되며, 상기 지그이동부(100a)는, 동력부(110)와 상기 동력부(110) 하측에 위치한 높이조절부(120)와 상기 높이조절부(120) 하측에 위치한 연결체(140)와 상기 연결체(140) 하측에 위치한 지그회전체(150)와 상기 지그회전체(150)의 하측에 위치한 전극지그(160)와 상기 전극지그(160) 하측에 위치한 소정의 수직길이로 형성된 전극(170)과 상기 전극(170)의 하측에 위치하여 피가공물의 가공부위에 접촉하는 제1전극팁(183)으로 구성된 양극전극부(180)를 포함하는 것을 특징으로 한다.

be4e6867f9736b290b5d37a797cea414184e6ac8.title: ELECTROSTATIC CHUCK
be4e6867f9736b290b5d37a797cea414184e6ac8.abstract: An electrostatic chuck 10 includes a dielectric substrate 100, an internal electrode 140 provided inside the dielectric substrate 100, a base plate 200 in which a through hole 230 is formed, a power supply member 400 that is a member for supplying power to the internal electrode 140 and is inserted through the through hole 230, and an insulating member 500 arranged between an inner surface of the through hole 230 and the power supply member 400. The insulating member 500 includes a tubular first insulating member 510, and a tubular second insulating member 520 covering a part of the first insulating member 510 on an outer peripheral side. The electrostatic chuck 10 further includes an annular member 530 for preventing an electric discharge along a path from the power supply member 400 to the inner surface of the through hole 230 passing between the first insulating member 510 and the second insulating member 520.

5172f434d193bd1b828ec23ed1c2b7e0f050496d.title: ACTIVE INKING SYSTEM FOR SELF-SERVICE BANKING EQUIPMENT
5172f434d193bd1b828ec23ed1c2b7e0f050496d.abstract: The invention relates to an active inking system (1) which is fixed to the paying module (25) of self-service equipment. Said system includes a modification in the upper cover (4) of the cassette (24), where three upper holes (5) and one front hole (6) are made; the upper holes (5) fix the spreader assembly (2) and the front hole (6) receives the male quick coupler (13) through which the ink (29) enters. The system (1) comprises a spark sensor (14), component fixing structure (12), male quick coupler (13), ink cylinders (15), screws (16), ink outlet connections (20), actuating trigger (17), CO2 gas cylinders (18), tubes (19) and connections (21) for compressed gas. The spreader assembly (2) comprises a tank (10) aligned with the front opening (6) of the top cover (4) of the cassette (24), the tank (10) in communication with the spreader tube (8) equipped with holes (9) directed to the notes (7) through which the ink (29) is ejected for marking them. The sparks (27) activate the spark sensor (14) that activates the trigger (17), breaks the seal (28) of the CO2 cylinder (18), pressurizes the tubes for compressed gas (19), moves the front (22) and rear (23) pistons and pushes the ink (29).

13323d71a5487b2ddff4ca44b1c80cf3dca41217.title: CONFIGURATIONS DE CIRCUITERIE PARTAGÉE POUR LA GÉNÉRATION DE PLASMA
13323d71a5487b2ddff4ca44b1c80cf3dca41217.abstract: The present disclosure provides shared circuitry configurations that may be implemented in a plasma generation system to improve control over application of electrical energy to a plasma generator, thereby providing improved performance. In some embodiments, shared circuitry configurations described herein may be implemented to improve performance of a traveling spark igniter that is configured to generate and propagate plasma using a Lorentz force and a thermal force, such as by applying electrical energy to electrodes of a plasma generator following breakdown between the electrodes. Other plasma generator configurations may also benefit from the circuitry configurations described herein.

022cabe4b053654a3ae45776cb3bc791f73c2682.title: Enhanced electrostatic discharge trap for microphones
022cabe4b053654a3ae45776cb3bc791f73c2682.abstract: An electrostatic discharge trap device for protecting a water-resistant microphone from electrostatic discharge may include a conductive material positioned between a microphone port and a microphone venting stack-up to prevent liquid entry into the microphone, wherein the electrostatic discharge trap device is configured to receive an electric spark from the microphone port and conduct the electric spark away from the microphone venting stack-up to a conductive layer.

features: Diverts electric sparks away from venting stack-up

e82c7ec4a7a4c81bf63420cd925ee06c04c92053.title: INTRAVASCULAR LITHOTRIPSY CATHETER WITH OMNI-DIRECTIONAL SHOCK WAVE EMITTERS
e82c7ec4a7a4c81bf63420cd925ee06c04c92053.abstract: An exemplary catheter for generating shock waves includes a catheter body; an enclosure mounted to the catheter body; an emitter band positioned at least partially around the catheter body and within the enclosure; and at least three electrodes positioned adjacent to the emitter band and spaced apart from the emitter band by respective spark gaps, the at least three electrodes together with the emitter band forming electrode pairs of at least three shock wave emitters of the emitter band, wherein at least one of the at least three shock wave emitters can be driven separately from at least one other of the at least three shock wave emitters.

85458c7330f27864b034f45ac746a9dd20d91862.title: CATHÉTER DE LITHOTRIPSIE INTRAVASCULAIRE À ÉMETTEURS D'ONDES DE CHOC OMNIDIRECTIONNELS
85458c7330f27864b034f45ac746a9dd20d91862.abstract: An exemplary catheter for generating shock waves includes a catheter body; an enclosure mounted to the catheter body; an emitter band positioned at least partially around the catheter body and within the enclosure; and at least three electrodes positioned adjacent to the emitter band and spaced apart from the emitter band by respective spark gaps, the at least three electrodes together with the emitter band forming electrode pairs of at least three shock wave emitters of the emitter band, wherein at least one of the at least three shock wave emitters can be driven separately from at least one other of the at least three shock wave emitters.
85458c7330f27864b034f45ac746a9dd20d91862.system_message:

9e612ec93402b937c504e0df1dada7259c5d13b5.title: PROCÉDÉ DE COMMUNICATION ET APPAREIL DE COMMUNICATION
9e612ec93402b937c504e0df1dada7259c5d13b5.abstract: The present application provides a communication method and a communication apparatus, applied to the field of communications. The technical solution of the present application can support IEEE protocols, such as IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT protocol, IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8 protocol, Integrated mmWave/integrated millimeter wave/IMMW protocol, IEEE 802.15/UWB protocol, IEEE 802.11bf/sensing protocol, or spark link/nearlink standard protocol. In the technical solution of the present application, sensing devices indicate relative position acquisition related information, thereby facilitating acquisition of the relative position between the sensing devices, improvement of the accuracy of a sensing result and the flexibility of sensing device deployment, and broadening of the range of application scenarios of sensing measurement.

5c39016655f1b42cc981bc46bfa73974b4119d97.title: An ELR communication method, apparatus and readable storage medium
5c39016655f1b42cc981bc46bfa73974b4119d97.abstract: This application relates to an ELR communication method, apparatus and readable storage medium. The method comprises: generating and sending an ELR PPDU. The ELR PPDU comprises a first field, which is generated based on an ELR identification sequence, and the ELR identification sequence is carried on 53 subcarriers whose subcarrier indexes are -26 to 26. The elements of the ELR identification sequence on the subcarriers whose subcarrier indexes are {-24,-20,-16,-12,-8,-4,4,8,12,16,20,24} are all 0. This application can improve the accuracy of packet detection. This application supports IEEE protocols such as 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, integrated millimeter wave/IMMW, UWB, or Sensing. This application also supports the spark link/spark link/nearlink standard protocol, etc.

df69da7b3d58e48b79aee937a6467f14d9a20889.title: Thermal runaway test system with ignition capability and thermal runaway test method for lithium battery wherein the system comprises a machine body, a test chamber, a cover, a battery test trough, a thermal runaway triggering device, an igniter, and a control device
df69da7b3d58e48b79aee937a6467f14d9a20889.abstract: This invention relates to a thermal runaway test system and thermal runaway test method for lithium batteries. The thermal runaway test system includes a machine body, a test chamber, a cover, a battery test trough, a thermal runaway triggering device, an igniter, and a control device. The test chamber is disposed in the machine body and has a chamber and an opening. The cover is movable between a closed position and an open position. The battery test trough is located in the chamber and is used for placing a lithium battery. The thermal runaway triggering device is controllable to apply at least one trigger to the lithium battery. An ignition end of the igniter extends into the chamber. The control device is electrically connected to the thermal runaway triggering device and the igniter. The control device controls the thermal runaway triggering device to generate the at least one trigger, and controls the ignition end of the igniter to generate a spark in the chamber.

cc641b5eaab617eb3d2ec9ba35f16e76ec4e4f33.title: SHARED CIRCUITRY CONFIGURATIONS FOR PLASMA GENERATION
cc641b5eaab617eb3d2ec9ba35f16e76ec4e4f33.abstract: The present disclosure provides shared circuitry configurations that may be implemented in a plasma generation system to improve control over application of electrical energy to a plasma generator, thereby providing improved performance. In some embodiments, shared circuitry configurations described herein may be implemented to improve performance of a traveling spark igniter that is configured to generate and propagate plasma using a Lorentz force and a thermal force, such as by applying electrical energy to electrodes of a plasma generator following breakdown between the electrodes. Other plasma generator configurations may also benefit from the circuitry configurations described herein.

a063996d02ded5afde08b72ad409935d6f985813.title: HYDROPHOBIC FILTER MEDIUM
a063996d02ded5afde08b72ad409935d6f985813.abstract: A filter medium is provided that comprises a nonwoven layer. The nonwoven layer comprises a sizing agent and a hydrophobic, stiffening binder resin. The nonwoven layer may be corrugated. A method producing a filter medium is also provided. The filter medium may be a fuel filter, oil filter, air filter, or an electric discharge filter. The filter medium, after corrugation, pleating, or embossing, avoids or minimizes water ingress, while still allowing the filter medium to maintain its structural and filtration properties.

25a5ab167f6a3557ce5163aa3bd5c165118814ac.title: SUBSTRATE TREATMENT APPARATUS AND SUBSTRATE TREATMENT METHOD
25a5ab167f6a3557ce5163aa3bd5c165118814ac.abstract: The present invention provides an apparatus for treating a substrate. The apparatus for treating a substrate may include: a process treatment unit that provides a treatment space in which the substrate is treated; and a plasma generation unit that is provided above the process treatment unit and generates plasma from a process gas. The plasma generation unit includes: a plasma chamber having an electric discharge space formed therein; a shield unit surrounding the exterior of the plasma chamber; an antenna which surrounds the shield unit from the outside of the shield unit and to which high-frequency power is applied; and a connecting unit electrically connecting the shield unit and the antenna.

b216e5a388d0391604ea0cf72354ff0463b2652e.title: SYSTEM AND METHOD OF NANOCARBON MATERIALS MANUFACTURING BY PULSE ELECTRIC DISCHARGE IN LIQUID
b216e5a388d0391604ea0cf72354ff0463b2652e.abstract: A system for manufacturing a nanomaterial may include a first electrode; a second electrode spaced apart from the first electrode by a gap; and a chamber configured to enclose the first electrode, the second electrode, and a liquid. The system may also include a power supply configured to provide electrical energy to at least one of the first electrode and the second electrode; and a pump configured to cause the liquid to flow through the gap between the first electrode and the second electrode.

a2d3fce43224b5efcee6170704019fc5add0f234.title: DISPOSITIF DE COMMANDE POUR MACHINE D'ÉLECTROÉROSION PAR FIL ET PROCÉDÉ DE COMMANDE POUR USINAGE PAR ÉLECTROÉROSION PAR FIL
a2d3fce43224b5efcee6170704019fc5add0f234.abstract: This control device for a wire electric discharge machine includes: a movement control unit that causes a wire electrode to move along a machining path; a voltage control unit that controls a machining power supply and applies a machining voltage across poles; and a machining control unit that maintains a non-discharge state in which discharge does not occur between the poles until the wire electrode reaches a first position on the machining path, that, upon the wire electrode reaching the first position, gradually increases the discharge density so that the discharge density of the discharge becomes a set value set as a machining condition, and that, upon the wire electrode reaching the first position again, gradually decreases the discharge density to achieve a non-discharge state.

3cc1c2e2214236157aedf8b82df8cc8c883ab11f.title: Electric discharge machine for precision process
3cc1c2e2214236157aedf8b82df8cc8c883ab11f.abstract: 본 발명은 전극의 세팅시간을 줄이고 작업능률을 향상시킬 수 있는 정밀 세팅 및 가공을 포함하는 정밀 가공용 방전 가공기에 관한 것으로서, 상측의 헤드부(100)와 하측의 거치부(200)로 구분하면서 헤드부(100)와 거치부(200) 사이가 개방된 형태로 형성된 본체부, 상기 본체부에 구비되며 피가공물(20)이 거치되는 거치부(200), 상기 거치부(200)의 상면에 돌출 형성되어 상기 피가공물(20)이 지지되며 전류가 흐르는 음극전극부, 상기 거치부(200)의 상면을 마주하도록 배치되며 전류가 흐르는 양극전극부(180) 및, 상기 양극전극부(180)를 고정하면서 높이 및 좌우이동을 제어하는 지그이동부(100a)를 구성하며, 상기 지그이동부(100a)는, 동력부(110)와 상기 동력부(110) 하측에 위치한 높이조절부(120)와 상기 높이조절부(120) 하측에 위치한 연결체(140)와 상기 연결체(140) 하측에 위치한 지그회전체(150)와 상기 지그회전체(150)의 하측에 위치한 전극지그(160)와 상기 전극지그(160) 하측에 위치한 소정의 수직길이로 형성된 전극(170)과 상기 전극(170)의 하측에 위치하여 피가공물의 가공부위에 접촉하는 제1전극팁(183)으로 구성된 양극전극부(180)를 포함하며, 상기 양극전극부(180)는, 전극(170) 하단에 연결되는 수직형 제1몸체(181-1)와 상기 제1몸체(181-1)의 일측면 하단에서 수평으로 연결되면서 상면 중앙에서 하면 중앙으로 관통된 제1체결공(181-3)이 형성된 제2몸체(181-2)로 구성된 제1지지부(181)와, 상기 제1지지부(181)의 제2몸체(181-2) 하부에 배치되어 제1체결공(181-3)의 위치에 대응된 제2체결공(182-1)이 형성되면서 하면 중앙에 제1전극팁(183)의 상부를 결속하는 제1삽입공이 형성된 전극연결체(182)를 포함하는 것을 특징으로 한다.

07ffa65cd50210a2c6c1c2beb6acbbd1d9f8594d.title: Electric discharge machining system for precision setting and process
07ffa65cd50210a2c6c1c2beb6acbbd1d9f8594d.abstract: 본 발명은 전극의 세팅시간을 줄이고 작업능률을 향상시킬 수 있는 정밀 세팅 및 가공을 포함하는 방전 가공 시스템에 관한 것으로서, 외관을 형성하는 본체부, 상기 본체부에 구비되며 피가공물이 거치되는 거치부(200), 상기 거치부(200)의 상면에 돌출 형성되어 상기 피가공물이 지지되며 전류가 흐르는 음극전극부, 상기 거치부(200)의 상면을 마주하도록 배치되며 전류가 흐르는 양극전극부(180), 상기 양극전극부(180)를 고정하면서 높이 및 좌우이동을 제어하는 지그이동부(100a) 및, 상기 피가공물의 방전가공을 제어하는 방전제어모듈을 포함하는 방전가공기가 구비되며, 상기 방전제어모듈은, 피가공물의 3D 도면을 이용하여 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공을 자동으로 수행하는 방전가공프로그램과, 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공시 상기 방전가공기에 설치된 센서들의 측정값을 화면에 표시하고 동작 상태를 실시간으로 화면에 표시하는 모니터와, 상기 방전가공기의 동작을 제어하는 신호를 입력하는 동작스위치 입력부와, 상기 방전가공프로그램을 저장하고, 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공 측정값을 시간대별로 저장하는 메모리 및, 상기 동작스위치 입력부의 입력 신호와 상기 방전가공프로그램에 따라 방전 가공을 자동 수행을 제어하는 제어부로 구성되며, 상기 지그이동부(100a)는, 동력부(110)와 상기 동력부(110) 하측에 위치한 높이조절부(120)와 상기 높이조절부(120) 하측에 위치한 연결체(140)와 상기 연결체(140) 하측에 위치한 지그회전체(150)와 상기 지그회전체(150)의 하측에 위치한 전극지그(160)와 상기 전극지그(160) 하측에 위치한 소정의 수직길이로 형성된 전극(170)과 상기 전극(170)의 하측에 위치하여 피가공물의 가공부위에 접촉하는 제1전극팁(183)으로 구성된 양극전극부(180)를 포함하는 것을 특징으로 한다.

46caa28357cd3b44eb84c5010cd7b045c93ff14d.title: ELECTROSTATIC CHUCK
46caa28357cd3b44eb84c5010cd7b045c93ff14d.abstract: An electrostatic chuck 10 includes a dielectric substrate 100, an internal electrode 140 provided inside the dielectric substrate 100, a base plate 200 in which a through hole 230 is formed, a power supply member 400 that is a member for supplying power to the internal electrode 140 and is inserted through the through hole 230, and an insulating member 500 arranged between an inner surface of the through hole 230 and the power supply member 400. The insulating member 500 includes a tubular first insulating member 510, and a tubular second insulating member 520 covering a part of the first insulating member 510 on an outer peripheral side. The electrostatic chuck 10 further includes an annular member 530 for preventing an electric discharge along a path from the power supply member 400 to the inner surface of the through hole 230 passing between the first insulating member 510 and the second insulating member 520.

f33514a67beac3b8033d504293bfadc5d91b14d5.title: DISPOSITIF DE LEVAGE DE RÉSERVOIR D'USINAGE POUR MACHINE À DÉCHARGE ÉLECTRIQUE
f33514a67beac3b8033d504293bfadc5d91b14d5.abstract: This machining tank lifting device of an electric discharge machine lifts a machining tank (4) in which a machining liquid is stored. The machining tank lifting device of the electric discharge machine includes: a drive source (1) and a rack pinion (2) for lifting the machining tank (4) on the depth side of the machining tank (4); and a cylinder (5), having the function of preventing the front side of the machining tank (4) from dropping down in relation to the depth side, on the front side of the machining tank (4).

e025b1e4e308b4705e57e8f644e4d55bc4c3c044.title: Co shift unit for the conversion of solid waste into syngas
e025b1e4e308b4705e57e8f644e4d55bc4c3c044.abstract: According to the invention, solid recovered fuel pellets are torrefied to charred pellets, producing torrefaction gas that is converted into a torrefaction syngas containing hydrogen and carbon monoxide. A syngas stream comprising the torrefaction syngas is supplied to a CO shift unit, where carbon monoxide reacts with water steam to carbon dioxide and hydrogen, generating shifted syngas. The invention provides that the shifted syngas is passed through a low temperature heat recovery unit, where its heat energy is transferred to at least two process water streams that are used as process water during the production of the product gas stream. By utilizing this heat, waste heat losses are reduced, and the overall energy efficiency of the process is improved. Further, an increased hydrogen content of the product gas is achieved.

b9db38ce48220ed69a818fb48d7c08d07be4049b.title: TRAITEMENT DE CHARGES D'ALIMENTATION MONOCOTYLÉDONES POUR DÉPULPAGE
b9db38ce48220ed69a818fb48d7c08d07be4049b.abstract: Feedstock including an amphiphilic lignocellulosic biomass can be processed using enzymes prior to pulping. The enzymes break down the biomass by disrupting the surface or cell walls or by reducing wax or other components. Such enzymes include cellulases, hemicellulases, laccases, peroxidases, and pectinases. Suitable enzymes can be obtained from secretions of microbes in soil organic matter from soil in which the feedstock was grown. If the pulping process includes steam explosion, such enzy matic processing of a biomass prior to steam explosion will increase absorption of water by the processed feedstock. In steam explosion, due to the increased ability of the processed feedstock to absorb water, steam explosion is more effective in breaking apart the processed feedstock. For other pulping processes, such enzymatic treatments break down the biomass, enabling extraction of the desired components from the processed feedstock through subsequent processing using less energy and fewer chemicals.
b9db38ce48220ed69a818fb48d7c08d07be4049b.system_message:

79d834e805d3289fe4ac719b8b0e1b922fb9f196.title: GÉNÉRATEUR DE FUMÉE ET SYSTÈME FOURNISSANT DES PARTICULES DE FUMÉE DANS UNE ARMOIRE À FUMÉE
79d834e805d3289fe4ac719b8b0e1b922fb9f196.abstract: The present invention relates to a smoke generator (10; 10a; 10b) comprising a housing (15) with a condensate inlet (11) for receiving a smoke condensate and a steam inlet (12) for receiving overheated water steam, wherein the smoke condensate is converted to smoke particles when the smoke condensate interacts with the overheated water steam, and the smoke particles are accessible at a smoke outlet (13). The invention also relates to a system for feeding smoke particles to a smoke cabinet (23).

64bb08a457298acaa08283318a36e69ac5236a57.title: Stable supply system for hydrogen production by clean energy and control method thereof
64bb08a457298acaa08283318a36e69ac5236a57.abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of hydrogen production, in particular to a stable supply system for hydrogen production through clean energy and a control method of the stable supply system. The gas mixing chamber is used for mixing methanol steam and desalted water steam to form mixed gas; the heat preservation chamber is arranged outside the gas mixing chamber and is used for preserving heat of the gas mixing chamber through hydrogen mixed gas output by the reaction chamber; the reaction hydrogen production unit is connected with the raw material mixing unit and is used for providing chemical reaction conditions of the mixed gas to generate hydrogen mixed gas of hydrogen and carbon dioxide; the gas separation unit is used for separating the hydrogen mixed gas to output pure hydrogen; the detection unit is used for detecting the internal air pressure of the gas mixing chamber, the air pressure of the gas inlet of the reaction chamber, the air pressure of the gas outlet of the reaction chamber and the vibration frequency of the gas mixing chamber; the hydrogen production stability is improved.

e2bfb6ca5dca409f0661f08844bf4a52d09112ca.title: Steam-water separation device for cooking equipment and cooking equipment
e2bfb6ca5dca409f0661f08844bf4a52d09112ca.abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of kitchen appliances, in particular to a steam-water separation device for cooking equipment and the cooking equipment, the steam-water separation device for the cooking equipment comprises a separator, the separator comprises a separation pipe and a separation plate, the separation plate is arranged in the separation pipe and divides the separation pipe into a steam inlet side and a steam outlet side, and the steam inlet side is communicated with the steam outlet side. Screen holes are formed in the separation plate, steam flows in from one end of the separation pipe, penetrates through the screen holes in the separation plate and flows out from the other end of the separation pipe, and the separation plate is used for water-steam separation. The steam passes through the separation plate through the sieve holes of the separation plate, and in the process, the separation plate can intercept water drops, so that the water drops can be intercepted more efficiently, water accumulation is reduced, the influence on food nutrition and taste is reduced, and the use effect of the cooking equipment is improved.

e9b645be4417727e2f3f14f03121a13bb12143a4.title: Selective condensation mechanism and wastewater treatment equipment and method with selective condensation function
e9b645be4417727e2f3f14f03121a13bb12143a4.abstract: The invention discloses a selective condensation mechanism and wastewater treatment equipment and method with selective condensation, the selective condensation mechanism is a condensation plate, the condensation plate comprises a main body part and a selective condensation coating covering the main body part, the main body part is internally provided with a cooling cavity used for containing a refrigerant, and the selective condensation coating covers the main body part. The affinity of the selective condensation coating and impurities in waste water steam is greater than that of the main body part and the impurities in the waste water steam; or the selective condensation mechanism is a condensation pipeline, the condensation pipeline comprises an inner pipeline and an outer pipeline which are sleeved with each other, a cooling cavity used for containing a refrigerant is formed between the inner pipeline and the outer pipeline, and the selective condensation coating is arranged on the inner wall of the inner pipeline; the affinity of the selective condensation coating and impurities in waste water steam is greater than that of the condensation plate and the impurities in the waste water steam. The energy consumption in the condensation process can be reduced, and organic components in waste water can be separated and recycled easily.

883613751460f0429354d4b3f15c778cc39ffe9c.title: Flow control sauna machine
883613751460f0429354d4b3f15c778cc39ffe9c.abstract: The utility model discloses a flow control sauna machine, and belongs to the technical field of steam sauna machines. A flow control sauna machine comprises a switching box, a water inlet part is arranged at the front end of the switching box, and a bag body is arranged in the rear end of the switching box; a water outlet is formed in the water inlet part, and a connecting pipeline is arranged between the water outlet and the bag body, so that the water inlet part is communicated with the bag body; a flow blocking piece is arranged at the lower end of the water outlet, the flow blocking piece floats on the liquid level, close to the water outlet end, in the connecting pipeline under the normal condition, the density of the flow blocking piece is smaller than that of water, and the flow blocking piece does not have water absorption; the diameter of the flow blocking piece is larger than that of the water outlet. The diameter of the flow blocking piece is smaller than that of the connecting pipeline. Water-steam conversion can be effectively carried out by reducing the water drainage speed, and water backflow is prevented.

4576589586e724672bf742646b0e3a3b2fa7924d.title: Water-vapor separation box, faucet and multifunctional water dispenser
4576589586e724672bf742646b0e3a3b2fa7924d.abstract: The water vapor separation box comprises a box body, one side of the box body is provided with a hot water inlet, the other side of the box body is provided with a water outlet nozzle, the water outlet nozzle is provided with a steam exhaust outlet and hot water outlets, the hot water outlets comprise the first hot water outlet and the second hot water outlet, and the steam exhaust outlet is communicated with the steam exhaust outlet. A stop block is arranged above the water outlet nozzle; the bottom wall of the inner cavity of the box body is inclined from the hot water inlet to the stop block to form an inclined surface; by designing the reasonable layout of the hot water inlet, the hot water outlet and the steam exhaust outlet and arranging the stop block and the inclined bottom wall in the box body, steam and water flow can be effectively separated in the flowing process of hot water. Steam is discharged through the steam discharging channel, hot water is discharged through the hot water channels with different heights according to the hydrodynamic law, efficient water vapor separation is achieved, and it is ensured that output hot water is more stable and purer.

f9d6765790d354ad36539a1b6957d2ae26990688.title: Zero-power-consumption thermal power cold end system vacuum optimization device
f9d6765790d354ad36539a1b6957d2ae26990688.abstract: The invention discloses a zero-power-consumption thermal power cold end system vacuum optimization device, which belongs to the technical field of vacuum optimization, and comprises a front vacuum absorber, an annular water-gas self-oscillation processing mechanism, a gas-gas-liquid self-separation device and a gas-liquid isolation secondary separation device which are sequentially connected in series, and the output end is connected with a condenser hot well through a gas-liquid isolation secondary separation device. The chemical replenishment water is dynamically mixed with the steam-steam mixture at the outlet of the condenser through jet entrainment, so that water steam is condensed, after the formed steam-steam mixture is separated, non-condensable gas is extracted by vacuumizing equipment, and liquid is recycled to a hot well. The device does not need extra energy consumption, the vacuum degree of the condenser is effectively improved through multi-stage mixing, separation and recovery closed loops, and coal consumption and operation cost are reduced.

7c1cebd09c66faa48e8e65c13a569d4e4554b753.title: APPAREIL DE FABRICATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
7c1cebd09c66faa48e8e65c13a569d4e4554b753.abstract: The present invention relates to an apparatus for manufacturing lithium sulfide. By using the apparatus according to the present invention, when manufacturing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions as compared to the prior art, such that frequent repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping is not required, thereby improving the economic efficiency of the process. In addition, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and a solvent, from which moisture has been removed, are reused, thereby reducing process costs and securing economic feasibility during mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thereby preventing a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promoting a forward reaction, thus enabling high-quality lithium sulfide to be produced with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size can be adjusted in units of ㎛ without a separate pulverization space or a separate pulverization step, thus providing excellent convenience and mass productivity.

962b249c7b622d8e979892f84f39ac3e8928db39.title: PROCÉDÉ DE PRÉPARATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
962b249c7b622d8e979892f84f39ac3e8928db39.abstract: The present invention relates to a method for preparing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when lithium sulfide is prepared by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction proceeds under relatively mild conditions compared with conventional technologies. Thus, repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of reactors and various piping components is not frequently required, thereby improving the economic feasibility of the process. In addition, the unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvent from which moisture has been removed can be reused, thereby reducing process costs and securing economic feasibility in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thereby preventing the reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promoting the forward reaction to prepare high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield.

0a47c9c61168c03a1859b14862f93234c368004f.title: PROCÉDÉ DE PRODUCTION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
0a47c9c61168c03a1859b14862f93234c368004f.abstract: The present invention relates to a method for producing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when producing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium source and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions compared to the prior art, and thus the economic efficiency of the process is improved since frequent repairs or replacements necessitated by corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping are not required. In addition, since dehydrated, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvents are recycled, the process cost is reduced, and thus economic efficiency can be achieved in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed to prevent a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promote a forward reaction, thereby enabling the production of high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size can be adjusted at a µm level without a separate pulverization space or pulverization step, and thus excellent convenience and mass productivity are achieved.

ca5c0a7c286dd5c68702e6bd025dd53f088237a2.title: PROCÉDÉ DE PRÉPARATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
ca5c0a7c286dd5c68702e6bd025dd53f088237a2.abstract: The present invention relates to a method for preparing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when preparing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is carried out under relatively mild conditions as compared to the prior art, and thus frequent repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping is not required, thereby improving the economic feasibility of the process. In addition, by reusing unreacted hydrogen sulfide from which moisture has been removed and a solvent, process costs are reduced, thereby ensuring economic feasibility during mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thus preventing a reverse reaction back to lithium hydroxide and promoting a forward reaction, thus enabling the production of high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size adjustment can be achieved in units of μm without a separate pulverization space or pulverization step, thereby providing excellent convenience and mass production.

67e5441f36965b43aa6fda47104b1b50be5dc518.title: SYSTÈME DE PRODUCTION D'HYDROGÈNE
67e5441f36965b43aa6fda47104b1b50be5dc518.abstract: Provided is a hydrogen production system (40) which comprises: an exhaust heat reception unit (41) that receives exhaust heat generated by an external exhaust heat source (11); a water vapor generation unit (42) that generates water vapor by heating water by means of the exhaust heat received by the exhaust heat reception unit (41); a cell stack (43) that electrolyzes the water vapor generated by the water vapor generation unit (42) so as to generate hydrogen; and a replenishment unit (44) that, when the amount of exhaust heat is insufficient with respect to the amount necessary for generating the required amount of water vapor, replenishes water, water vapor, or the water vapor generation unit (42) with heat, or replenishes the cell stack (43) with water vapor from an external water vapor supply source (95).

26b068a98be4be790520bdab02921e60302ccd2d.title: APPAREIL DE PRODUCTION DE BIOCHARBON POREUX À HAUTE PERFORMANCE
26b068a98be4be790520bdab02921e60302ccd2d.abstract: Disclosed is an apparatus for manufacturing a high-performance porous biochar, capable of preventing water vapor and gas in a carbonization facility from leaking to the outside, and preventing a coking phenomenon in which livestock manure remaining in a carbonization furnace adheres to the inner circumferential surface of the carbonization furnace. The apparatus for manufacturing a high-performance porous biochar comprises: a livestock manure supply facility for supplying and transferring a large amount of livestock manure containing moisture; and a carbonization facility for, when the livestock manure is input from the livestock manure supply facility, creating an oxygen-blocked atmosphere within the carbonization facility and heating the carbonization facility to a predetermined temperature to carbonize the livestock manure, wherein the livestock manure supply facility is configured to automatically open and close an outlet according to whether the livestock manure is discharged, and seal a connection portion between the livestock manure supply facility and the carbonization facility.

8a269e5920653fe8636574f98339b3413e7f1c35.title: SPECTROSCOPIE DE POLARISATION À EFFET STARK ET PROCÉDÉS
8a269e5920653fe8636574f98339b3413e7f1c35.abstract: A method of and system for monitoring the level of hydrogen peroxide gas in a system such as an isolation barrier. Gas is sampled from the system to a gas cell. The sampled gas may include hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor. A laser beam from a laser source at a known polarization state is passed through the gas cell and the hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor therein. An electrical field is created in the gas cell to reduce optical interference from water vapor while preserving the ability to more accurately measure the concentration of hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell. A change in the polarization state of the laser beam after passage through the gas cell is detected. Based on the detected change in the polarization state of the laser beam, the concentration of the hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell is determined.
8a269e5920653fe8636574f98339b3413e7f1c35.system_message:

654627382d7a19bb188033947bdff421f54dc001.title: STRUCTURE ORGANOMÉTALLIQUE
654627382d7a19bb188033947bdff421f54dc001.abstract: This metal organic framework comprises a first ligand that has a benzene ring and has two or more functional groups for coordination, and a second ligand that does not contain a benzene ring and contains one functional group for coordination. The ratio of the water vapor adsorption level per unit mass of the metal organic framework at a relative pressure of 0.95 to the water vapor adsorption level per unit mass of a basic structure MOF at a relative pressure of 0.95 is 84% or greater in a water vapor isotherm measured at 298K when a metal organic framework having only the first ligand as a ligand is identified as the basic structure MOF on the basis of the results of powder XRD analysis of the metal organic framework.

8330683d837781bf0ae62081a817932c52399ae4.title: Ultralow-temperature liquid hydrogen storage cabin
8330683d837781bf0ae62081a817932c52399ae4.abstract: An ultralow-temperature liquid hydrogen storage cabin is provided with a cylindrical inner cabin, the inner cabin is supported and fixed in an outer cabin through a filling layer, the inner cabin and the outer cabin form a filling layer space, and the filling layer space is filled with low-temperature LNG or low-temperature liquid nitrogen. The inner cabin is composed of an inner cabin outer wall and an inner cabin inner wall, the inner cabin outer wall and the inner cabin inner wall form a vacuum layer, and the vacuum layer is filled with perlite and vacuumized. A double-layer compartment is arranged, an insulating layer is laid on an outer compartment, an inner compartment is of a vacuum double-wall heat insulation structure, and the space between the inner compartment and the outer compartment is filled with LNG or liquid nitrogen with the temperature close to that of liquid hydrogen. According to the scheme, the ultralow-temperature liquid state maintenance of-163 DEG C LNG or-196 DEG C liquid ammonia medium is easily realized through a mature reliquefaction system, so that the liquid state maintenance of the ultralow-temperature-253 DEG C liquid hydrogen medium is indirectly ensured, the heat transfer between the liquid hydrogen cabin and the external environment can be greatly reduced, and the technical difficulty and the technical cost of ultralow-temperature storage of the liquid hydrogen are reduced.

2276f8ba3d507a18fe61d294cf18d50eaad891e7.title: Liquid hydrogen medium active exhaust cooling test system and method
2276f8ba3d507a18fe61d294cf18d50eaad891e7.abstract: The invention discloses a liquid hydrogen medium active exhaust cooling test system and method. The system comprises a vacuum module, a liquid hydrogen storage box module, a gas replacement and filling module, an exhaust cooling test module, a helium pressurization module, a leakage and safe discharge module, an external heat flow simulation module and a measurement and control module. According to the scheme, on the basis of simulating the external vacuum environment, the test of active exhaust cooling of the liquid hydrogen medium space is achieved through gas replacement, filling, testing and the like, and compared with the prior art, the liquid hydrogen medium space active exhaust cooling device is comprehensive in function.

b6d6f74036119b89aa4620b8ba739c2c5e73046a.title: Emergency cut-off stop valve for liquid hydrogen
b6d6f74036119b89aa4620b8ba739c2c5e73046a.abstract: The utility model provides an emergency cut-off stop valve for liquid hydrogen, which comprises a valve body, a valve clack, a fixer and a sealing ring, and the valve clack is arranged in the valve body; the valve clack is suitable for abutting against the side wall of a runner opening in the valve body. The fixer is connected with the bottom of the valve clack; the sealing ring is arranged between the valve clack and the fixator and is configured to protrude out of the circumferential side of the valve clack, and the part, protruding out of the circumferential side of the valve clack, of the sealing ring is suitable for abutting against the side wall of a runner opening in the valve body and sealing the runner opening; the side wall depth of a flow channel opening in the valve body is larger than the width of the sealing ring protruding out of the circumferential side of the valve clack. The depth of the side wall of the flow channel opening in the valve body is larger than the width of the part, protruding out of the circumferential side of the valve clack, of the sealing ring, after the sealing ring loses efficacy due to excessive abrasion, effective sealing can still be formed through tight attaching between the valve clack and the side wall of the flow channel opening in the valve body, and liquid hydrogen medium leakage is prevented.

fa040d2f8e3859104d7d95ebd3c4861727f8037a.title: Methane hydrogen regeneration olefin recovery system
fa040d2f8e3859104d7d95ebd3c4861727f8037a.abstract: The system is characterized in that the input end of a methane hydrogen heater is communicated with a demethanizer, and the output end of the methane hydrogen heater is communicated with the input end of a liquid phase dryer; the output end of the mixed C4 heater is communicated between the output end of the methane hydrogen heater and the input end of the liquid phase dryer; the output end of the gas-liquid separation tank is communicated with the input end of the regenerated methane hydrogen coalescer; and the output end of the regenerated methane hydrogen coalescer is communicated with the input end of an external fuel pipe network. According to the utility model, a mixed C4 steam stripping process and a regenerated methane hydrogen secondary dehydration process are added, so that the water content in regenerated methane hydrogen gas is ensured to meet the requirements of receiving conditions of a fuel gas pipe network. According to the system for regenerating and recycling olefin by using methane hydrogen, disclosed by the invention, a mixed C4 and methane hydrogen medium is self-produced, so that the purpose of regenerating and recycling ethylene-propylene olefin substances by using the liquid-phase dryer is achieved, the nitrogen consumption and the torch gas emission are reduced, and the ethylene-propylene yield and the resource utilization rate are improved.

7aca8a8fdeadcab012f2e595c58e1a1b199eec97.title: Graphene preparation system and method
7aca8a8fdeadcab012f2e595c58e1a1b199eec97.abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of graphene preparation, and provides a graphene preparation system and method.The system comprises a gas supply device, a plasma synthesis device, a gas-solid separation device, a product collection device, a tail gas separation device and a hydrogen storage device. The invention relates to a graphene preparation method, which comprises the following steps: ionizing a medium gas to generate plasma, and introducing a reaction gas to carry out a synthesis reaction; separating the reacted gas from a reaction product; settling and collecting the obtained reaction product; separating the obtained gas into hydrogen, medium gas and reaction gas; the medium gas and the reaction gas are recycled after being compressed, and the separated hydrogen is purified and stored. According to the technical scheme, the production cost is reduced, the material handling capacity is large, the productivity is high, the method is suitable for industrial application, energy consumption is low, pollution is avoided, expandability is high, and the application range is wide.

e080bc59a45e39f9363167505c0381d4cd804da2.title: Normal-pressure storage tank for storing liquid hydrogen
e080bc59a45e39f9363167505c0381d4cd804da2.abstract: The utility model provides a normal-pressure storage tank for storing liquid hydrogen. The normal-pressure storage tank comprises an inner tank made of metal and used for containing a low-temperature liquid hydrogen medium, an outer tank located outside the inner tank and made of metal, a heat insulation interlayer located in an interlayer between the inner tank and the outer tank and playing a heat insulation role, and a cold shield arranged in the heat insulation interlayer. The cold shield comprises a cold shield coil pipe which is made of a metal material and is coiled in the heat insulation interlayer, the inlet end of the cold shield coil pipe is connected with a boil-off gas outlet of the gas phase space at the top of the inner tank, and the outlet end of the cold shield coil pipe penetrates through the outer tank, extends out of the outer tank and is connected with a boil-off gas recovery device. The cold shield medium entering the cold shield is liquid hydrogen evaporated gas in the inner tank, the defect of high daily evaporation rate of a liquid hydrogen low-temperature normal-pressure storage technology can be overcome without introducing an external cold source, and the operation cost of the normal-pressure storage tank is reduced.

9548c78d9f38e43c6fc7f43f5702bbf3215a2f49.title: Structure and method for improving air tightness of rapid cooling section of continuous annealing furnace in high-hydrogen mode
9548c78d9f38e43c6fc7f43f5702bbf3215a2f49.abstract: The invention belongs to the technical field of plate and strip production and equipment, and particularly relates to a structure and method for improving air tightness of a rapid cooling section of a continuous annealing furnace in a high-hydrogen mode, the structure comprises a sealing roller chamber shell, a roller and sealing roller chamber shell lining refractory bricks, the bottom of the roller is in sealing connection with a graphite sealing gasket, and the bottom and the two ends of the graphite sealing gasket are fixed through castable; back lining plates are arranged between the two ends of the castable and the sealing roller chamber shell lining refractory bricks, the positions between the back lining plates and the sealing roller chamber shell lining refractory bricks are filled with micropore heat insulation plates, and gaps of the upper end, the side wall and the bottom in the sealing roller chamber are filled with ceramic fibers. The invention mainly aims to ensure the stability of the sealing roller chamber structure of the rapid cooling section, improve the sealing performance in the roller chamber, prevent excessive hydrogen medium from overflowing to the slow cooling section and the overaging section, save the consumption of hydrogen energy and ensure the safety of a unit.

44661807087b5319a7fbbdb3cb42479428ea74d6.title: Medium filtering method and device based on hydrogen purity instrument
44661807087b5319a7fbbdb3cb42479428ea74d6.abstract: The invention discloses a medium filtering method and device based on a hydrogen purity instrument. The method comprises the following steps: connecting a sampling pipe to a source of a medium to be measured so as to conveniently introduce the medium; the other end of the sampling pipe is connected with the filtering device, so that the medium passes through the sampling pipe before entering the filtering device; the filtered oil mist is adsorbed and sampled through a filter element in the filtering device, and the oil mist is separated from the hydrogen medium; oil gathered in the filtering device is introduced into the oil storage tank through the drainage pipe; a pressure sensing module and an automatic oil drain valve are installed at the bottom of the oil storage tank. According to the medium filtering method and device based on the hydrogen purity instrument, on one hand, the measurement accuracy of hydrogen purity parameters is improved, a reliable basis is provided for operators to monitor and maintain the purity of hydrogen, and the operation economy and safety of a generator are guaranteed; on the other hand, the automatic oil discharging valve is adopted to achieve the automatic sewage discharging function, the daily maintenance workload is reduced, and the automation level of equipment is improved.

c9a1aa4bf1c85ad736f596a681873f8ccab3a3ce.title: Storage cabin capable of storing ultralow-temperature liquid hydrogen
c9a1aa4bf1c85ad736f596a681873f8ccab3a3ce.abstract: A storage cabin capable of storing ultralow-temperature liquid hydrogen is provided with a cylindrical inner cabin, the inner cabin is supported and fixed in an outer cabin through a filling layer, the inner cabin and the outer cabin form a filling layer space, and the filling layer space is filled with low-temperature LNG or low-temperature liquid nitrogen. The inner cabin is composed of an inner cabin outer wall and an inner cabin inner wall, the inner cabin outer wall and the inner cabin inner wall form a vacuum layer, and the vacuum layer is filled with perlite and vacuumized. A double-layer compartment is arranged, an insulating layer is laid on an outer compartment, an inner compartment is of a vacuum double-wall heat insulation structure, and the space between the inner compartment and the outer compartment is filled with LNG or liquid nitrogen with the temperature close to that of liquid hydrogen. According to the scheme, the ultralow-temperature liquid state maintenance of-163 DEG C LNG or-196 DEG C liquid ammonia medium is easily realized through a mature reliquefaction system, so that the liquid state maintenance of the ultralow-temperature-253 DEG C liquid hydrogen medium is indirectly ensured, the heat transfer between the liquid hydrogen cabin and the external environment can be greatly reduced, and the technical difficulty and the technical cost of ultralow-temperature storage of the liquid hydrogen are reduced.

2086d159a1304d6e0009414cd3c8825ea119bde2.title: High-temperature solid hydrogen storage and SOEC coupling hydrogen production and storage integrated system and method
2086d159a1304d6e0009414cd3c8825ea119bde2.abstract: The invention discloses a high-temperature solid hydrogen storage and SOEC coupling hydrogen production and storage integrated system and method. The system comprises a water supply device, and the end of the water supply device is connected with a suction device; one end of the recovery device is connected with the suction device, and the other end is connected with a reaction device; the SOEC electrolytic reactor is connected with the reaction device, the SOEC electrolytic reactor comprises an anode end and a cathode end, and the anode end is connected with the recovery device; one end of the air delivery device is mounted between the reaction device and the SOEC electrolytic reactor, and the other end of the air delivery device is connected with a hydrogen high-temperature heat recovery device; the first end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with the hydrogen high-temperature heat recovery device, the second end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with the reaction device, the third end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with a condenser, the fourth end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with a dryer, and the condenser is connected with the dryer. Medium-temperature and high-temperature heat energy released in the hydrogen storage process of the high-temperature metal hydride is recycled through the heat recycling device and used for producing high-temperature superheated steam needed by SOEC electrolysis, and the good heat and mass synergistic effect is achieved on the whole.
2086d159a1304d6e0009414cd3c8825ea119bde2.system_message:

e13947114c7f8db74b28ceff5afc694f25e92ff7.title: METHOD AND UNIT FOR PREPARATION AND FINE PROCESSING OF HYDROCARBON STOCK
e13947114c7f8db74b28ceff5afc694f25e92ff7.abstract: FIELD: oil and gas production. ^ SUBSTANCE: invention refers to a method of preparing and fine processing of hydrocarbon stock involving heating of stock and hydrogen, preparation of end-products; herewith liquid (oil, black oil, oil refining and petrochemistry remains) charge stock is heated up to the temperature above 20-50C and exposed to thermal and/or thermomechanical (non-catalytic) cracking, molecular hydrogen and/or hydrogen enriched light hydrogenous mediums (natural or accompanying gas, gas and light fractions of oil refining and petrochemistry), if required are heated up separately from charge stock, supplied at greater pressure than that of the heating stage, to the stage of producing active atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals to a reactor or reactor package with a catalyst heated to the required temperature, thereafter produced active hydrogen and/or light radicals are supplied to a stock heating and cracking zone for the reaction; the reaction products are supplied to the separation stage; a portion of gas and light fractions and also unreacted hydrogen and/or light hydrogenous initial mediums after the separation stage are supplied to the start of the process and introduced into the charge stock, light end fractions of reaction after the separation stage mainly with end boiling point to 350-360C, partially or completely supplied on the stage of producing light end commodity products (condensed gas, petrol, kerosene, diesel fuel) and/or partially returned and introduced into charge stock, heavy remains after the separation stage mainly with start boiling point 360C and above, are partially or completely supplied for producing heavy commodity products (bitumen, coke), and, probably, partially or completely supplied for reprocessing by the given method to the start of the process together with charge stock; the stock and/or separation remain cracking and heating stages, hydrogen and/or hydrogenous medium and catalyst heating, production of active atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals and separation into light portion and heavy remains are combined in one device, and the ratio of the surface of the reactor or reactors with the catalyst to volume of the stock heating and/or cracking shall be increased so that maximally increase the interaction (reaction) area of atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals and heated or cracked hydrocarbon stock for effective utilisation of reacting products. The invention also concerns a unit for preparation and fine processing of hydrocarbon stock. ^ EFFECT: higher yield of light end products. ^ 19 cl, 3 tbl, 15 dwg
e13947114c7f8db74b28ceff5afc694f25e92ff7.system_message:

10febd2374559ff64cdf9e5b1d1b601075c8ec12.title: COMPOSITION AND METHOD FOR MANUFACTURING ETTRINGITE COATED FIBER AND AGGLOMERATE
10febd2374559ff64cdf9e5b1d1b601075c8ec12.abstract: PURPOSE: A fiber is provided to sediment an ettringite crystalline on the surface of the fiber or the other disposition in a hydrogenous medium. CONSTITUTION: An ettringite coated agglomerate is manufactured by: generating an ettringite in a hydrogenous slurry while being near a fiber, an agglomerate, or other filling material for forming a mineralized complex material including an ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, or other filling material; and the ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, and other filling material reacting in the existence of water for forming the ettringite by adding a reactive material such as a calcium oxide and a sulfuric aluminium being sedimented to the surface of the treated fiber or the other disposition. Therefore, the ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, and other filling material are added to a hydrogenous hardening material for improving a chemical and a mechanical combinations between the fiber and other dispositions in a concrete material.

a1c4c738dbc83f7521557eba68dd445aa28d32f5.title: Bipolarplatte sowie Brennstoffzelle mit einer Bipolarplatte
a1c4c738dbc83f7521557eba68dd445aa28d32f5.abstract: The plate (10) has a main surface for a fuel cell stack, where the surface is surrounded by outer edges (14) of the plate. A cathode input and a cathode output are provided at a cathode side, and an anode input and an anode output are provided at an anode side. A hydrogenous medium is fed to the anode side and a medium containing oxygen is fed to the cathode side. An outer edge of the stack is freely accessible, where the plate is coated at its outer edges by a sealant (15) and the sealant forms a frame (16) around the plate. A polymer material is provided as the sealant.

02bd3c850f517340aa3a641481114b00d924693f.title: MATÉRIAU D'ACIER INOXYDABLE AUSTÉNITIQUE
02bd3c850f517340aa3a641481114b00d924693f.abstract: Provided is an austenitic stainless steel material that has high strength and excellent fatigue crack propagation resistance in a hydrogen environment. The chemical composition of the austenitic stainless steel material of the present disclosure, as defined in the description, satisfies formula (1); the elemental content and grain size number (GSN) in μm satisfy formula (2); and the tensile strength (TS), which is 730 MPa or more, the number density of inclusions (NDI) having an equivalent circle diameter of 2.0 μm or more per 4.0 mm2, and the number density of carbonitrides (NDC) having an equivalent circle diameter of 1.0 μm or more per mm2 satisfy formula (3).　(1) Nb + V ≤ 0.55; (2) 10FnA - 0.2FnB + 4.5GSN ≥ 39.0, where FnA and FnB in formula (2) are defined by formulas (A) and (B);　(A) FnA = 2N + C; (B) FnB = -7.1 + 2.8Ni + 0.49Cr + 2Mo - 2Si + 0.75Mn - 5.7C - 24N; (3) 0.5NDI + NDC + 0.02TS ≤ 30.0.

043548f2695ec0333859e2d0bb8894ea34c64df3.title: Method and system for synergistically testing and evaluating fatigue and fracture of metal material in hydrogen environment
043548f2695ec0333859e2d0bb8894ea34c64df3.abstract: The invention relates to a hydrogen environment metal material fatigue and fracture cooperative test and evaluation method and system, and belongs to the field of metal material hydrogen environment compatibility. The method comprises the following steps: performing a fatigue crack propagation test and a fracture toughness test on a fatigue and fracture synergistic test sample in a hydrogen environment with preset pressure and preset temperature; based on the obtained fatigue crack propagation curve and the obtained crack propagation resistance curve, obtaining a fatigue crack propagation fitting curve and a fracture toughness characteristic value in the hydrogen environment with the preset pressure and the preset temperature; and based on the fatigue crack propagation fitting curve and the fracture toughness characteristic value in the hydrogen environment with the preset pressure and the preset temperature, safety evaluation of the metal material simulated hydrogen conveying pipeline under the fatigue load working condition is completed. The fatigue crack test is replaced by the fracture toughness test according to the defect length, the fatigue and fracture cooperative test is realized, the sample replacement is not needed, the test material is saved, the test preparation time for the sample replacement and cooling process is reduced, and the test efficiency is improved.

e0c90177c69a8dcc2391b95e7f57dc8a392b4a8b.title: Full-size PE pipeline hydrogen permeation and aging test integrated equipment
e0c90177c69a8dcc2391b95e7f57dc8a392b4a8b.abstract: The utility model discloses full-size PE pipeline hydrogen permeation and aging test integrated equipment which comprises a high-temperature aging oven, supporting plates are fixedly installed at the two ends of the bottom of an inner cavity of the high-temperature aging oven, a sealing mechanism used for testing is arranged at the tops of the supporting plates, and a PE pipe body is arranged on the inner side wall of the sealing mechanism; according to the utility model, the high-temperature aging oven, the sealing mechanism, the air intake and exhaust mechanism, the pressure reading instrument and the gas chromatograph are arranged in a matched manner, so that the hydrogen permeability of the full-size PE pipeline can be tested, and meanwhile, an aging test can be carried out in a hydrogen environment, thereby improving the test effect; the hydrogen permeability coefficient of hydrogen-doped natural gas in a PE pipeline can be measured through gas chromatography, so that the requirements of people are met, sealing operation during testing is achieved through the sealing mechanism, the gas inlet and outlet mechanism is used for achieving gas inlet and outlet operation during testing, and the pressure reading instrument and the gas chromatograph are used for analyzing and recording obtained data.

d8016b56f3643631d33015ea5b5fa2afd4592fda.title: Salt rock creep experiment device in high-pressure hydrogen environment
d8016b56f3643631d33015ea5b5fa2afd4592fda.abstract: The invention provides a rock salt creep experiment device in a high-pressure hydrogen environment, and belongs to the technical field of rock experiments, the rock salt creep experiment device comprises a cavity, the top and the side of the cavity are provided with openings, a top cover and a side cover, the top cover and the side cover are used for sealing the two openings respectively, and the side cover is provided with an observation window; an air injection hole and an exhaust hole are formed in one side, deviating from the side cover, of the side wall of the cavity, and the air injection hole is higher than the exhaust hole; the experiment assembling structure is arranged in the cavity, and the experiment assembling structure comprises a sample placing table, a limiting assembly and a loading rod; the gas injection and recovery system is arranged on one side of the cavity and used for injecting high-pressure hydrogen into the cavity and recovering the high-pressure hydrogen in the cavity; and the shooting system is arranged on one side where the side cover of the cavity is located and comprises a shooting device and a light source. By means of the salt rock creep experiment device in the high-pressure hydrogen environment, the safety of the experiment device can be improved, and potential safety hazards caused by the circuit and air tightness problems are reduced.

47bd53268f0c7de5a0f3b12ffffae5a331554561.title: MATÉRIAU D'ACIER D'ALLIAGE AUSTÉNITIQUE DE TYPE À DURCISSEMENT PAR PRÉCIPITATION ET SON PROCÉDÉ DE FABRICATION, ET MATÉRIAU D'ACIER TRAITÉ THERMIQUEMENT EN ALLIAGE AUSTÉNITIQUE DE TYPE À DURCISSEMENT PAR PRÉCIPITATION ET SON PROCÉDÉ DE FABRICATION
47bd53268f0c7de5a0f3b12ffffae5a331554561.abstract: Provided is a method for manufacturing an austenitic alloy steel material that can improve mechanical properties even without improving a composition of a steel material and 5 an increase in the service life of a component in a high-pressure hydrogen environment can be expected. A method for manufacturing a precipitation-hardening austenitic alloy steel material, the method including: a hot forging step of providing a material for forging having a composition of the precipitation-hardening austenitic alloy steel material, and performing hot forging several times so that a total forging forming ratio is 30 or more, to form a forged 10 material. The method preferably includes a heat treatment step of additionally subjecting the forged material to a solution treatment and an aging treatment, to obtain a heat-treated steel material.

0a2635439d642898470f7b9e58b22c7a7c8c1d0f.title: High-performance material combination for ultrahigh-speed permanent magnet motor driven hydrogen circulating pump and application process
0a2635439d642898470f7b9e58b22c7a7c8c1d0f.abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of ultrahigh-speed motor materials and hydrogen energy equipment, in particular to a high-performance material combination for an ultrahigh-speed permanent magnet motor driven hydrogen circulating pump, which comprises a permanent magnet material: a neodymium iron boron 42SH magnet is adopted and subjected to Dy-Cu co-doping treatment, and the surface of the magnet is coated with a nickel-phosphorus alloy coating of 10-15 microns; the rotor sheath is made of TC11 titanium alloy (containing 3.5%-4.5% of Mo), and the hardness of the TC11 titanium alloy reaches 38-42 HRC after beta heat treatment; a pump body and an impeller are made of a combined structure of Hastelloy C276 and a SiC particle reinforced aluminum matrix composite (the volume fraction of SiC is 15%-20%), and the inner wall of the pump body is sprayed with a 50-80-micron diamond-like carbon (DLC) coating; hydrogen embrittlement resistance and stability are enhanced, the hydrogen embrittlement critical value of a key material is increased to 200 MPa.m < 1/2 > or above, and the continuous operation life under the 1.5 MPa hydrogen environment is longer than or equal to 8000 h and is prolonged by two times compared with a traditional material; the high-temperature magnetic performance attenuation rate of the permanent magnet is smaller than or equal to 5%, the fatigue strength of the rotor sheath is improved by 25%, and the requirement for long-term operation at the speed of 200000r/min is met.

34a3c8cff6414fdc7b30176e670a2a234fb844b9.title: Hydrogen circulating pump stator core structure adopting 0.05 mm silicon steel sheets
34a3c8cff6414fdc7b30176e670a2a234fb844b9.abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of motor iron core structures, in particular to a hydrogen circulating pump stator iron core structure adopting 0.05 mm silicon steel sheets. The hydrogen circulating pump stator iron core structure adopting 0.05 mm silicon steel sheets comprises an iron core body which is formed by laminating a plurality of silicon steel sheets with the thickness of 0.05 mm in the axial direction, and the surfaces of the silicon steel sheets are provided with insulating coatings; the stator yoke part is located on the periphery of the iron core body and is of an annular structure, and the thickness of the yoke part is 15-20 mm; the stator tooth parts are uniformly distributed along the inner circumference of the stator yoke part, the number of the stator tooth parts is 12-24, the width of each tooth part is 5-8mm, and a wire slot is formed between every two adjacent tooth parts; the eddy current path is shortened by the ultra-thin silicon steel sheets of 0.05 mm, and the high-frequency iron loss is reduced by more than 40% and the motor efficiency is improved by 5-8% by combining high-frequency low-loss materials; and the heat dissipation grooves and the graphene heat-conducting fins have a synergistic effect, so that the temperature rise of the iron core is reduced by 15-20 DEG C, and high-temperature potential safety hazards in a hydrogen environment are avoided.

35d4ca5ed5fafe5d3d0ef8052d0af6a34a2c8da2.title: High-pressure piston type hydrogen compressor cylinder surface PVD coating and preparation process thereof
35d4ca5ed5fafe5d3d0ef8052d0af6a34a2c8da2.abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of compressor cylinder body surface coating, and discloses a high-pressure piston type hydrogen compressor cylinder body surface PVD preparation process which comprises the following steps: step 1, matrix laser microtexturing and plasma activation: machining micro-pit arrays on the surfaces of a cylinder sleeve and a piston by adopting a pulse fiber laser; and the oxide layer is removed through Ar < + >/H2 mixed plasma etching, and a nanoscale activated surface is generated. According to the method, the film-substrate binding force is remarkably enhanced through laser microtexture and plasma activation, and the coating is prevented from being peeled off; by utilizing a multi-layer composite structure and a rare earth doping technology, the coating structure is extremely densified, a hydrogen permeation path is effectively blocked, and hydrogen embrittlement is fundamentally inhibited; gradient design and fluorinated hydrophobic treatment are adopted, so that the surface is endowed with low friction coefficient and super-hydrophobicity, and abrasion and corrosion are reduced; meanwhile, high hardness, high toughness and excellent corrosion resistance are considered, and the reliability, durability and safety of the cylinder body in the high-pressure hydrogen environment are comprehensively improved.

d16130fafe863c430e02a298d3920e73a8798131.title: Multiphase preparation method of aniline derivative
d16130fafe863c430e02a298d3920e73a8798131.abstract: The invention belongs to the technical field of fine chemicals and related chemistry, and provides a heterogeneous preparation method of an aniline derivative, which comprises the following steps: taking a nitrobenzene derivative as a raw material, and reacting in an organic solvent at 60-100 DEG C for 24 hours in a hydrogen environment under the action of a high-entropy alloy catalyst to obtain the corresponding aniline derivative. According to the method, the high-entropy alloy is used as the catalyst, the reaction selectivity is high, the reaction system is simple, the substrate compatibility is good, the highest yield can reach 97% or above, and the catalyst is good in stability and can be recycled. The aniline derivative prepared by the invention has a wide range of applications, and has an extremely important position in drug design and drug synthesis.

5c6ceae1716d1af6079e6206ca12897be7f4238c.title: Intelligent agent test equipment for intelligently and efficiently evaluating fatigue crack growth rate of hydrogen pipeline steel and use method of intelligent agent test equipment
5c6ceae1716d1af6079e6206ca12897be7f4238c.abstract: The invention relates to intelligent agent test equipment for intelligently and efficiently evaluating the fatigue crack growth rate of hydrogen pipeline steel and a use method of the intelligent agent test equipment. The problem that the fatigue crack growth rate test efficiency of a material is low under the gaseous hydrogen environment and the fatigue coupling effect is solved. The equipment mainly comprises a high-purity N2 gas cylinder, a high-purity H2 gas cylinder, a hydrogen-doped gas cylinder I, a hydrogen-doped gas cylinder II, an electromagnetic valve I, an electromagnetic valve II, an electromagnetic valve III, an electromagnetic valve IV, a gas inlet pipeline, a vacuum pump, a vacuum gauge, a pressure gauge, a high-pressure hydrogen environment fatigue crack growth rate performance test system and an artificial intelligence decision and control system. Multi-field coupling conditions such as stress amplitude, frequency, pressure and hydrogen doping ratio can be integrated, and the crack propagation behavior of a pipeline steel material in an actual hydrogen service environment can be simulated. A direct-current potential drop device is used for monitoring the fatigue crack propagation state in real time, an artificial intelligence model is embedded at the same time, and load, environment and crack data collected in real time are subjected to online analysis.

71ed26dd160f04bb06c949cbd18d6d203c79f02a.title: ACTIVE INKING SYSTEM FOR SELF-SERVICE BANKING EQUIPMENT
71ed26dd160f04bb06c949cbd18d6d203c79f02a.abstract: The invention relates to an active inking system (1) which is fixed to the paying module (25) of self-service equipment. Said system includes a modification in the upper cover (4) of the cassette (24), where three upper holes (5) and one front hole (6) are made; the upper holes (5) fix the spreader assembly (2) and the front hole (6) receives the male quick coupler (13) through which the ink (29) enters. The system (1) comprises a spark sensor (14), component fixing structure (12), male quick coupler (13), ink cylinders (15), screws (16), ink outlet connections (20), actuating trigger (17), CO2 gas cylinders (18), tubes (19) and connections (21) for compressed gas. The spreader assembly (2) comprises a tank (10) aligned with the front opening (6) of the top cover (4) of the cassette (24), the tank (10) in communication with the spreader tube (8) equipped with holes (9) directed to the notes (7) through which the ink (29) is ejected for marking them. The sparks (27) activate the spark sensor (14) that activates the trigger (17), breaks the seal (28) of the CO2 cylinder (18), pressurizes the tubes for compressed gas (19), moves the front (22) and rear (23) pistons and pushes the ink (29).

47d66074bcf56c9d7c70e818a5c0db9598791ea9.title: CONFIGURATIONS DE CIRCUITERIE PARTAGÉE POUR LA GÉNÉRATION DE PLASMA
47d66074bcf56c9d7c70e818a5c0db9598791ea9.abstract: The present disclosure provides shared circuitry configurations that may be implemented in a plasma generation system to improve control over application of electrical energy to a plasma generator, thereby providing improved performance. In some embodiments, shared circuitry configurations described herein may be implemented to improve performance of a traveling spark igniter that is configured to generate and propagate plasma using a Lorentz force and a thermal force, such as by applying electrical energy to electrodes of a plasma generator following breakdown between the electrodes. Other plasma generator configurations may also benefit from the circuitry configurations described herein.

160bbecf1eed9918c67ad1a4a079980723044cd8.title: Enhanced electrostatic discharge trap for microphones
160bbecf1eed9918c67ad1a4a079980723044cd8.abstract: An electrostatic discharge trap device for protecting a water-resistant microphone from electrostatic discharge may include a conductive material positioned between a microphone port and a microphone venting stack-up to prevent liquid entry into the microphone, wherein the electrostatic discharge trap device is configured to receive an electric spark from the microphone port and conduct the electric spark away from the microphone venting stack-up to a conductive layer.

9d7de8901a7ac3e7c776abf46ca02f765a5f68b9.title: INTRAVASCULAR LITHOTRIPSY CATHETER WITH OMNI-DIRECTIONAL SHOCK WAVE EMITTERS
9d7de8901a7ac3e7c776abf46ca02f765a5f68b9.abstract: An exemplary catheter for generating shock waves includes a catheter body; an enclosure mounted to the catheter body; an emitter band positioned at least partially around the catheter body and within the enclosure; and at least three electrodes positioned adjacent to the emitter band and spaced apart from the emitter band by respective spark gaps, the at least three electrodes together with the emitter band forming electrode pairs of at least three shock wave emitters of the emitter band, wherein at least one of the at least three shock wave emitters can be driven separately from at least one other of the at least three shock wave emitters.

d84d513523192aa8792ecb9685dce5847dd477b4.title: PROCÉDÉ DE COMMUNICATION ET APPAREIL DE COMMUNICATION
d84d513523192aa8792ecb9685dce5847dd477b4.abstract: The present application provides a communication method and a communication apparatus, applied to the field of communications. The technical solution of the present application can support IEEE protocols, such as IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT protocol, IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8 protocol, Integrated mmWave/integrated millimeter wave/IMMW protocol, IEEE 802.15/UWB protocol, IEEE 802.11bf/sensing protocol, or spark link/nearlink standard protocol. In the technical solution of the present application, sensing devices indicate relative position acquisition related information, thereby facilitating acquisition of the relative position between the sensing devices, improvement of the accuracy of a sensing result and the flexibility of sensing device deployment, and broadening of the range of application scenarios of sensing measurement.
