51ac1ff1b562f35b32aba7f0737602d6994d54a7.title: Agilawood essential oil distillation extraction equipment
51ac1ff1b562f35b32aba7f0737602d6994d54a7.abstract: The invention belongs to the technical field of agilawood essential oil distillation, and particularly relates to agilawood essential oil distillation extraction equipment which comprises a distillation kettle body, a sealing plate is in threaded connection with a feeding hole of the distillation kettle body; the distillation kettle body is fixedly connected with a condensation pipe; by arranging brand-new agilawood essential oil distillation extraction equipment, the functions of uniform heating, efficient extraction and effective cleaning of raw materials are achieved, a distillation kettle body serves as a main container and is used for containing a mixture of agilawood raw materials and water, steam is introduced through two air inlet connectors for heating, liquid level changes in the distillation process are monitored by a liquid level device, and the liquid level is controlled by a controller. The opening or closing of a gas guide pipe on a gas guide plate is controlled through a partition assembly, uniform heating of raw materials at all parts in the equipment is ensured, a plurality of bent arc pipes are arranged on the outer wall of the gas guide pipe, the heating range is further expanded, the uniform heating effect is improved, a servo motor drives stirring blades to stir the raw materials in the distillation process, the heating uniformity is improved, and the distillation efficiency is improved. The distillation extraction quality is improved.

0b1a2d1ebc7dabcefd9598bdf8cd95ad67954b9a.title: Water vapor separation device
0b1a2d1ebc7dabcefd9598bdf8cd95ad67954b9a.abstract: The utility model discloses a water vapor separation device which comprises a separation device main body, a separation cavity is arranged in the separation device main body, a plurality of water inlet pipes, a plurality of water outlet pipes and a plurality of exhaust pipes are arranged on the separation device main body, and the exhaust pipes are arranged at the top of the separation device main body. According to the water-steam separation device, when hot water and high-temperature steam enter the water inlet pipe through the hot water supply pipe and then enter the separation cavity of the separation device body, the hot water flows to the water drainage pipe along the inner bottom face of the separation cavity through the separation effect of the separation cavity on the hot water and due to the fact that the water is heavier than the high-temperature steam; the high-temperature steam is slowly focused above the separation cavity and is discharged through the exhaust pipe to realize water-steam separation, so that stable flowing of hot water is kept, the situation that the hot water splashes to scald a user when the steam is sprayed out along with the hot water is prevented, and the use safety of the water dispenser is improved.

a5c0a7678c1a5fb7c45faf8f723edf34e8f4a13b.title: SURFACE INTEGRATION OF HYDROGEN GENERATION, STORAGE, AND INTEGRATION AND UTILIZATION OF WASTE HEAT FROM ENHANCED GEOLOGIC HYDROGEN PRODUCTION AND DECARBONATION REACTIONS
a5c0a7678c1a5fb7c45faf8f723edf34e8f4a13b.abstract: A method of producing hydrogen and sequestering carbon or sulfur includes generating a fluid including at least one of water, steam, hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide and heat as a byproduct of a surface facility and injecting the fluid into a subsurface formation. The subsurface formation can include a porous rock, in various forms of porosity such as intragranular, intergranular, fracture porosity. The method can further include heating the fluid to stimulate an exothermic reaction of the fluid with components of the subsurface rock formation and produce a hydrogen reaction product and one or more of sulfur minerals from the hydrogen sulfide or carbon minerals from the carbon dioxide. The fluid can be heated to between about 25°C and about 500°C. The method can also include extracting the hydrogen produced from the reaction of the fluid with the subsurface rock formation and mineralizing at least one of the sulfur or carbon in the porous rock.

a0aad3ebf17c84d0e80ed20597fcb466855a8b7c.title: Static electricity eliminating, atomizing and humidifying device of PVC powder conveying system
a0aad3ebf17c84d0e80ed20597fcb466855a8b7c.abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of chemical production, in particular to a static electricity eliminating, atomizing and humidifying device of a PVC (polyvinyl chloride) powder conveying system, which aims to solve the problem that resin fluidity becomes poor due to the fact that moisture of PVC resin particles is reduced and static electricity is increased due to friction, blowing loss and the like in the PVC powder conveying process at present. According to the device, separation of steam and condensate drops is effectively guaranteed through the water-steam separator capable of achieving automatic buffering and gravity separation, the partition plate and the pore plate liquid remover, the drain valve is arranged at the bottom of the water-steam separator, when condensate water in the water-steam separator reaches a certain liquid level, automatic drainage is achieved, and controllable drainage is achieved; a large amount of condensate water is prevented from entering the pneumatic conveying system to influence the resin quality, the spiral steam spray head utilizes saturated steam to increase the humidity of airflow of the pneumatic conveying system, static electricity and resin moisture loss in the resin conveying process are effectively reduced, and therefore the quality of PVC products is guaranteed.

d8ac8c54becb00f6c9fd4893c76da4998729bbe0.title: Method for counting production consumption of pulping and papermaking DCS (Distributed Control System)
d8ac8c54becb00f6c9fd4893c76da4998729bbe0.abstract: The invention discloses a production consumption statistical method of a pulping and papermaking DCS control system, and the method comprises the following steps: S1, carrying out the numerical initialization integer of data needing to be accumulated, taking each second as a unit, and recording the data as a pre-integrating variable; s2, integrating the variables before integrating by using an integrating operation module, and performing accumulation once in one second by using the integrating operation module; s3, recording an integrating result in different time periods, and calling a CPU system clock to execute data recording once at 8 o'clock, 16 o'clock and 23 o'clock in 59 minutes and 58 seconds; and S4, realizing communication between the CPU and an upper computer provided with RSVIEW32 software through the Ethernet by using the exchanger, and increasing display pictures. According to the pulping and papermaking DCS control system, a production consumption statistical method is adopted, a novel structural design is adopted, based on process requirements, production material integrating including clear water, steam, aluminum sulfate, a sizing agent and other data is added, a data accumulation function program is designed on the DCS, an accumulation function block of the system is mainly applied, and the principle is that input signals are accumulated once per second.

fa4eff7f0aa2be4f722013ce368b9c9408753d42.title: Steam generator for preparing dry steam
fa4eff7f0aa2be4f722013ce368b9c9408753d42.abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of steam production, and discloses a steam generator for producing dry steam, which is characterized in that a water channel is arranged in a first-stage thick film heating pipe, and the first-stage thick film heating pipe heats water flowing into the water channel into wet steam; a steam channel is arranged in the second-stage thick film heating pipe, and the second-stage thick film heating pipe heats wet steam conveyed by the water channel into dry steam. The first-stage thick film heating pipe and the second-stage thick film heating pipe are of an integrated connection structure. According to the steam generator, the first-stage thick film heating pipe and the second-stage thick film heating pipe are integrated into an integrally-connected structure, and a water-steam separator does not need to be additionally connected, so that all components of the steam generator for preparing dry steam are relatively concentrated, and the size is relatively small; and the advantages of high power density, high heating speed, high working temperature, high temperature rise rate, high mechanical strength, small size, convenience in installation, uniformity in heating, long service life, energy conservation, environment friendliness and the like of the thick film heating bodies forming the first-stage thick film heating tube and the second-stage thick film heating tube are fully utilized.

dbfc6e1e81d18a8595e9ca7ad52dc8028bd18581.title: Sludge waste gas treatment device
dbfc6e1e81d18a8595e9ca7ad52dc8028bd18581.abstract: The utility model discloses a sludge waste gas treatment device and belongs to the field of sludge waste gas treatment. A sludge waste gas treatment device comprises a base plate, a first end base and a second end base are installed at the two ends of the top of the base plate respectively, a kiln body is arranged between the first end base and the second end base, the sludge waste gas treatment device further comprises a waste gas recovery device communicated with the first end base and the second end base, and the waste gas recovery device comprises a draught fan communicated with the interior of the second end base through a gas conveying pipe. One end of the fan is communicated with the water-steam separator through a gas conveying pipe, one end of the water-steam separator is communicated with a storage tank through a gas conveying pipe, the storage tank is communicated with the interior of the first end seat through a gas conveying pipe, a spiral feeder is arranged at the top of the second end seat, a combustor is installed at the outer end of the first end seat, and a slag outlet in the first end seat is located below the combustor; by means of the waste gas recovery device, combustible waste gas generated during calcination in the kiln body is recovered and ignited again through the combustor, and waste gas emission is reduced.

c7f5a497f4903158a9253a200af56827b09812d7.title: Water-steam separator
c7f5a497f4903158a9253a200af56827b09812d7.abstract: The utility model belongs to the technical field of water-steam separators, and particularly relates to a water-steam separator which comprises a heating body, the heating body is connected with a water inlet pipe through a corrugated pipe, a water-steam separating structure is formed by a sealing disc, a round pipe, a connecting block and a water outlet pipe, and the surface of the sealing disc is smooth and not prone to being adhered with scale. The sealing cover is installed on the flow dividing pipe through threads and extruded on the sealing disc through the circular ring, and when the water vapor separation structure needs to be taken out, the sealing cover is rotated to be taken down from the flow dividing pipe. A worker can directly hold the water outlet pipe with the hand to move downwards and take out the water vapor separation structure composed of the sealing disc, the round pipe, the connecting block and the water outlet pipe from the flow dividing pipe, and the worker can conveniently replace the water vapor separation structure and maintain or clean the water vapor separation structure; and all the structures are matched for use, so that the problem that the water outlet flow of the water-vapor separator is reduced due to the fact that threads on the water-vapor separation structure are prone to causing the unsmooth surface incrustation solidification condition is solved.

21e8169ce98157950c05616a9978eb97001b5c64.title: Device for adjusting steam by using ejector
21e8169ce98157950c05616a9978eb97001b5c64.abstract: The utility model relates to a device for adjusting steam by using an ejector, which comprises the ejector, a Rafael nozzle, an expansion pipe, a first input pipeline, a second input pipeline, an output pipeline, a demineralized water component, a pressure adjusting component and a temperature adjusting component, the Rafael nozzle is arranged in the ejector, the expansion pipe is arranged on the ejector, and the first input pipeline and the second input pipeline are communicated with the output pipeline. The first input pipeline is arranged at the end, away from the expansion pipe, of the ejector, the second input pipeline is arranged at the end, close to the expansion pipe, of the ejector, the output pipeline is arranged at the output end of the expansion pipe, the demineralized water assembly is arranged on the expansion pipe, and the pressure adjusting assembly is arranged on the ejector. And the temperature adjusting assembly is arranged on the demineralized water assembly. According to the device, the energy of high-pressure steam pressure reduction is fully utilized, so that the consumption of steam in a water steam stripping method and the energy consumption in a temperature and pressure reduction process are reduced.

c890b828d12cdde03cc0c770dbe002d09a58b447.title: Treatment method for improving water-steam ratio of raw gas of gasification device in coal chemical industry
c890b828d12cdde03cc0c770dbe002d09a58b447.abstract: The invention discloses a treatment method for improving the raw gas water-steam ratio of a coal chemical gasification device, and the coal chemical gasification device comprises a gasification furnace, a washing tower, an ash water system, a steam injection device and a circulating water system. The method is realized by installing a high-precision temperature sensor and a high-precision pressure sensor on an outlet pipeline of the gasification furnace, and the sensors transmit temperature and pressure data collected in real time to a control system. By monitoring the temperature and pressure of the raw gas at the outlet of the gasification furnace in real time and calculating the target water-steam ratio according to the preset water-steam ratio correlation model, parameters such as washing water flow, steam injection amount and circulating water temperature can be accurately adjusted according to actual working conditions, and accurate control of the water-steam ratio of the raw gas is realized. The stability of the subsequent process and the product quality are improved.

8bf282a7552ad88b5f934addd50dbdfac173a0d4.title: Intelligent temperature control instantaneous sterilization and rapid cooling equipment
8bf282a7552ad88b5f934addd50dbdfac173a0d4.abstract: The invention provides intelligent temperature control instantaneous sterilization and rapid cooling equipment. The intelligent temperature control instantaneous sterilization and rapid cooling equipment comprises a bottom plate, a shell is arranged at the upper end of the bottom plate, a water drainage pipe is arranged on one side of the shell, a water steam drainage hole is formed in the upper end of the shell, an inner container is arranged in the shell, and the outer surface of the inner container is in threaded connection with a pressurization top cover; an electric telescopic rod is fixedly connected to the top inner wall of the pressurizing top cover, a pressing plate is fixedly connected to the lower end of the electric telescopic rod, a second water inlet pipe is fixedly connected to the inner wall of the shell, a cooling-water machine is fixedly connected to the upper end of the bottom plate, and a water pump is installed in a water tank of the cooling-water machine; the outer surface of the inner container is fixedly connected with a heating resistance ring, a sealing heat insulation sleeve is arranged outside the inner container, and through the structure, efficient sterilization can be achieved, cooling can be conducted in time, the humidity in the inner container can be reduced in time, and adverse effects of the high-humidity environment on the inner container and objects in the inner container are prevented.

d47ad64a1e8995eed852332c2dd3f9d877081fc3.title: A zero emission process for producing syngas
d47ad64a1e8995eed852332c2dd3f9d877081fc3.abstract: Process for producing syngas comprising the steps of:a) burning methane or natural gas with oxygen and optionally with water steam for producing flue gas comprising CO2 and H2O according to the following reaction:C⁢H4+2⁢O2→CO2+2⁢H2⁢O[1]b) cooling the flue gas coming from a) by heat exchange with a water stream which is thereby vapourised;c) condensing and removing water from the flue gas, coming from step b), thereby obtaining a mixture consisting essentially of CO2;d) carrying out an electrolysis of a steam stream in a solid oxide electrolytic cell (SOEC), whereby steam is split into oxygen gas and hydrogen gas according to the following reaction scheme:H2O(g)→H2+1/2⁢O2[2]e) separating and drying hydrogen gasf) carrying out a reverse water gas shift reaction between CO2 coming from step c) with H2 coming from step e) according to the following scheme:CO2+H2→CO+H2O.[3]

5dafaa5c70a8e7e37214a95abcabd4d4e8189d43.title: A FLUIDIZED BED BOILER PLANT AND A METHOD OF PREHEATING COMBUSTION GAS IN A FLUIDIZED BED BOILER PLANT
5dafaa5c70a8e7e37214a95abcabd4d4e8189d43.abstract: A fluidized bed boiler plant (10) and a method of preheating combustion gas fluidized bed boiler plant, the boiler plant comprising a furnace (12) and a combustion gas channel (24, 24b), and a water-steam cycle comprising an evaporator section (26), a superheater section comprising a last superheater (30) and a steam turbine (34), and a superheating path for conveying steam from the evaporator section (26) via the superheater section to the steam turbine, and a first combustion gas preheater (38, 38b), wherein the fluidized bed boiler plant comprises a second combustion gas preheater (40, 40b), a steam extraction line (46, 46b) attached in flow connection with the second combustion gas preheater and with the superheating path in a location upstream of the last superheater for conveying steam from the superheating path to the second combustion gas preheater, wherein the method for preheating combustion gas comprises conveying steam from the superheating path from a location upstream of the last superheater via the steam extraction line to the second combustion gas preheater, and transferring heat from the steam to the combustion gas in the second combustion gas preheater. (Fig. 2)

aa0dd2da5a19ffdf1b47ba5be3a04ad58492e406.title: Hot water and steam multipurpose electric heating furnace
aa0dd2da5a19ffdf1b47ba5be3a04ad58492e406.abstract: The utility model discloses a hot water steam multipurpose electric heating furnace which comprises an electric heater and a furnace body, and further comprises a cold water collecting pipe, a hot water collecting pipe and at least one coil pipe, water and cold water are stored in an inner cavity of the furnace body, the hot water collecting pipe is in a barrel shape and located above the cold water collecting pipe, a pipe body of the cold water collecting pipe is arranged in the inner cavity of the furnace body, and the coil pipe is arranged in the inner cavity of the furnace body. A cold water inlet end of the cold water collecting pipe is arranged on the outer side of the furnace body, a pipe body of the hot water collecting pipe is arranged in an inner cavity of the furnace body, a hot water outlet end of the hot water collecting pipe is arranged on the outer side of the furnace body, the coil pipe is vertically arranged in the inner cavity of the furnace body in a spiral shape, and a pipe opening in the lower end of the coil pipe is communicated with an inner cavity of the cold water collecting pipe. A pipe opening in the upper end of the coil pipe is communicated with an inner cavity of the hot water collecting pipe, the boiler body is vertically arranged, and a steam outlet is formed in the top end of the boiler body. The multi-heat-source heat supply system can provide hot water media and steam media, the two heat supply media are independent of each other, and the multi-heat-source heat supply requirement of a user is met.

82f6d2751c6b0080eac1fc13847acaae6b44474d.title: Upper boiler barrel of boiler
82f6d2751c6b0080eac1fc13847acaae6b44474d.abstract: The upper boiler barrel comprises a barrel body, a front sealing head and a rear sealing head, an underwater pore plate parallel to an axis is arranged in the barrel body along the lower position of the axis, the left side and the right side of the underwater pore plate are respectively connected with a baffle which inclines upwards, the upper ends of the baffles are fixedly connected with the inner wall of the barrel body, and the lower ends of the baffles are fixedly connected with the lower end of the barrel body. Through holes are formed in positions, corresponding to the left and right baffles, of the barrel and are connected with the ascending pipe; a sealing plate is arranged at the front ends of the underwater pore plate and the two baffles, the lower edge of the sealing plate is lower than the underwater pore plate, a pore plate parallel to the underwater pore plate is arranged between the lower edge of the sealing plate and the front sealing head, and a through hole is formed in the position, corresponding to the pore plate, of the cylinder body and connected with a downcomer. According to the technical scheme, it can be ensured that a water-steam mixture entering from the ascending pipe can only flow into the lower half part of the cavity of the barrel firstly, then steam penetrates through the underwater pore plate and enters the upper half part of the cavity of the barrel upwards, first-time steam-water separation is achieved, and the water inlet of the descending pipe can be prevented from forming vortexes.

f413beb25d3a689b82398004598d4a59fe28c620.title: Drying, sterilizing and heating cabinet for medicine bags
f413beb25d3a689b82398004598d4a59fe28c620.abstract: The medicine bag drying, sterilizing and heating cabinet comprises a water storage tank and a heating part, and the water storage tank is provided with a steam channel and a water return channel; a plurality of disinfection boxes are sequentially arranged above the water storage tank, and each disinfection box is provided with an air inlet channel and an air outlet channel; a water-vapor separation part and a condensation box are arranged between the water storage tank and the disinfection box; the water-steam separation part is communicated between the steam channel and the air inlet channel; the water-vapor separation part is provided with a drainage channel which is communicated with the water return channel; the condensing box communicates with the air outlet channel and the water return channel; the condensation boxes are arranged on one sides of the corresponding disinfection boxes and are sequentially stacked above the water storage box, and the upper condensation box is communicated with the lower condensation box through a drainage pipe. The water storage tank is heated through the heating part to produce high-temperature and high-humidity steam, water in the steam is separated through the water-steam separation part, the high-temperature and low-humidity steam is obtained to dry and heat a medicine bag, the water is recycled to the water storage tank through the condensation box, and the medicine bag drying and heating device has the advantages of being small in consumption and high in safety.

2dc011952b9305db411cb9ed53ff353db204e722.title: Frying and baking machine
2dc011952b9305db411cb9ed53ff353db204e722.abstract: The utility model relates to a frying and baking machine which comprises a base assembly, an upper cover assembly and a water tank assembly, the upper cover assembly can cover the base assembly, the base assembly comprises a lower baking tray, the lower baking tray is provided with a cooking groove and a water groove, the water tank assembly is installed on the base assembly or the upper cover assembly, the water tank assembly comprises a box body and a pipeline, and the box body can be communicated with the water groove through the pipeline. A switch valve is arranged on the pipeline, the switch valve comprises a valve body and a valve element rotatably arranged in the valve body, and the switch valve controls the pipeline to be opened and closed through rotation of the valve element. According to the frying and baking machine, the water tank does not need to be filled with water before cooking, only the water needs to be added into the box body, only the valve element needs to be rotated to control opening and closing of the switch valve in the cooking process, then the box body can be controlled to add the water into the water tank or stop adding the water, steam can be rapidly generated, and the upper cover assembly does not need to be opened; therefore, the problem that the cooking effect is affected due to steam escape and rapid temperature reduction caused by uncovering and water adding is avoided.

c657a47f30c250dfe2cbf52d4da50da438ab22ed.title: POUDRE À STRUCTURE ORGANOMÉTALLIQUE
c657a47f30c250dfe2cbf52d4da50da438ab22ed.abstract: When a basic structure MOF that has only a ligand having two or more functional groups for coordination is specified as a ligand on the basis of the result of powder XRD analysis of this metal organic framework powder, the basic structure MOF has an octahedral particle shape. In an SEM image including 10 or more primary particles which have a particle diameter of 0.1 µm or more and in which at least one or more whole particle surfaces can be observed, if a ridge line having a length of 20 nm or less in a primary particle is assumed to be a point, the ratio of the number of primary particles in which all observed surfaces are triangular to the total number of primary particles observed is less than 40%. In the water vapor adsorption isotherm at 298 K, the ratio of the water vapor adsorption amount per unit volume of the metal organic framework powder to the water vapor adsorption amount per unit volume of the basic structure MOF when the relative pressure is 0.95 is 84% or more.

d952ad32a73ebdeb0acab6046fb17a30c86376d5.title: APPAREIL POUR AUGMENTER LA TENEUR EN GABA DE FEUILLES DE THÉ, PROCÉDÉ POUR AUGMENTER LA TENEUR EN GABA DE FEUILLES DE THÉ, ET PROCÉDÉ DE PRODUCTION DE THÉ GABA
d952ad32a73ebdeb0acab6046fb17a30c86376d5.abstract: Provided are an apparatus for increasing the GABA content of tea leaves, a method for increasing the GABA content of tea leaves, and a method for producing a GABA tea, by which it becomes possible to increase the GABA content in a short time and with a simple apparatus configuration.　The apparatus for increasing the GABA content of tea leaves is provided with: a low-temperature treatment means including a first low-temperature water vapor treatment means or a first low-temperature water immersion treatment means in which the temperature of the surface treatment of the tea leaves is maintained at a first temperature falling within the temperature range of 40-60°C for a predetermined set time; and a kill-green treatment means for deactivating an oxidation enzyme in the tea leaves that have been treated by the low-temperature treatment means.

314e0efa6ca6f2b8b7f975ad2c60381838fae663.title: ÉCRAN D'AFFICHAGE ET SON PROCÉDÉ DE PRÉPARATION, ET APPAREIL D'AFFICHAGE
314e0efa6ca6f2b8b7f975ad2c60381838fae663.abstract: Provided in the present application are a display panel and a preparation method therefor, and a display apparatus. The display panel comprises a display area and a non-display area located on at least one side of the display area. The display panel comprises a substrate, a driving circuit, an inorganic layer, an organic layer and hydrophobic particles, wherein the substrate is located in the display area and the non-display area; the driving circuit is located in the non-display area; the inorganic layer is located on the side of the driving circuit away from the substrate, is located at least in the non-display area, and covers the driving circuit; the organic layer is located on the side of the inorganic layer away from the substrate, and is located in the display area and the non-display area; the organic layer is provided with at least one groove running through the organic layer, and the groove is located in the non-display area; and the hydrophobic particles are located on the side of the driving circuit away from the substrate, and are at least some of the hydrophobic particles are filled in the groove. In this way, the speed of water vapor eroding a display panel can be slowed down, thereby prolonging the service life of the display panel.

e70fe3a78c90641fab248adeda4760d804dc9e74.title: DESALINATION AND CRYSTALLIZATION SYSTEM OPERATING WITHOUT BRINE
e70fe3a78c90641fab248adeda4760d804dc9e74.abstract: A zero liquid brine desalination and crystallization system includes a humidification dehumidification (HDH) desalination system and includes a crystallization system. The HDH system includes a humidifier configured to humidify a carrier gas using saline water, and a dehumidifier configured to dehumidify the carrier gas to obtain desalinated water. The crystallization system is configured to receive the saline water from the HDH desalination system and includes an evaporation chamber configured to produce salt crystals and water vapor from the saline water, and a condenser configured to condense the water vapor. Herein, the HDH desalination system and the crystallization system are connected at the condenser for heat exchange between the water vapor and at least one selected from the group consisting of the saline water and the carrier gas.

b023c0a32cdf7b66554c3a56f7964c631fc56ea4.title: MODULAR HYDROXYL RADICAL GENERATION AND OZONE-BASED DISINFECTION SYSTEM
b023c0a32cdf7b66554c3a56f7964c631fc56ea4.abstract: The present invention relates to modular ozone-based disinfection systems that generate hydroxyl radicals (·OH) from ozone and water vapor using a high-temperature catalyst module. The system includes a purification configuration with an air inlet, air circulation subsystem, airflow path, and air outlet, along with a water supply configuration feeding purified water to an electrolytic ozone generator. A catalyst module, such as a PTC heating element, heats ozone-containing air to a hydroxyl radical generation temperature, while a downstream hydroxyl augmentation and ozone reduction module converts residual ozone and conditions the airflow for safe discharge. Embodiments may include a replaceable water cartridge, resin tank, multiple water source options, humidity and purity sensors, and a safety interlock connected to a controller. The modular design supports portable, fixed, or refrigerated installations, enabling on-demand hydroxyl radical production with integrated control, safety, and discharge verification for advanced air and surface disinfection.

8d1198718ba0ac2853b4f87babfdf0be456e66ac.title: STARK EFFECT POLARIZATION SPECTROSCOPY AND METHODS
8d1198718ba0ac2853b4f87babfdf0be456e66ac.abstract: A method of and system for monitoring the level of hydrogen peroxide gas in a system such as an isolation barrier. Gas is sampled from the system to a gas cell. The sampled gas may include hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor. A laser beam from a laser source at a known polarization state is passed through the gas cell and the hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor therein. An electrical field is created in the gas cell to reduce optical interference from water vapor while preserving the ability to more accurately measure the concentration of hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell. A change in the polarization state of the laser beam after passage through the gas cell is detected. Based on the detected change in the polarization state of the laser beam, the concentration of the hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell is determined.

bf6f88b6479d23c0a93c21308a589ba24ed8ccf5.title: RED PHOSPHOR, PREPARATION METHOD THEREFOR, AND USE THEREOF
bf6f88b6479d23c0a93c21308a589ba24ed8ccf5.abstract: The present application discloses a red phosphor, and a preparation method and an application thereof and relates to the field of luminescent material technology. The chemical composition of the red phosphor is A2M(1-x)F6:xMn4+. The A is selected from at least one of alkali metal elements, and the M is selected from at least one of IVA group elements or a Ti element and a value range of the x is 0<x≤0.05. The red phosphor is granular; and a concentration of tetravalent manganese ions in a radial direction from a center of a particle of the red phosphor to a surface of the particle of the red phosphor decreases gradually. In the present application, the concentration of the activator Mn4+ in a radial direction from the center of the particle of the red phosphor to its surface is set to a descending gradient distribution to buffer the phosphor powder from the erosion of water vapor, thereby improving its anti-aging performance and prolonging the service life.

5340ba2c05a6df83fb171ecfd03ae8ebcfb6b4ff.title: JOHNSON AMBIENT ENERGY CONVERTER
5340ba2c05a6df83fb171ecfd03ae8ebcfb6b4ff.abstract: An environmental energy converter includes a housing having an upper portion and a lower portion. The lower housing portion has a hydrophobic material portion. The upper portion has a vent opening in fluid communication with the environment. The housing contains a hygroscopic mass within the lower housing portion that is in fluid communication with the hydrophobic material portion. An ion-electrode conducting membrane assembly is coupled to the housing to allow the passage of ionized water or water vapor through the ion-electrode conducting membrane and into contact with the hygroscopic solution. An air duct may be coupled to the housing to provide an airflow to the ion-electrode conducting membrane and/or to the hydrophobic material portion.

24a08af5688620f273b0a892fe2fec6f09b57b9f.title: PROCESO Y COMPOSICION PARA LA PRODUCCION DE CONCRETO POLIMERICO UTILIZANDO AGUA CON SAL COMO MEDIO DE REACCION.
24a08af5688620f273b0a892fe2fec6f09b57b9f.abstract: The present invention relates to an innovative process and composition for the manufacture of polymeric concrete using a salt water solution as a reaction medium. This approach replaces the glycols derived from fossil fuels, achieving a significant reduction in production costs between 30% and 40% and promoting environmental sustainability by generating water vapor as a reusable byproduct and allowing the recovery of up to 90% of the salt used. The composition includes an unsaturated polyester resin obtained from recycled PET bottles, styrene monomer, granulates and recycled sand, in addition to advanced additives such as graphene oxide, carbon black, and calcium carbonate, which together optimize the mechanical properties of the concrete. The production process incorporates ultrasonic dispersion technologies to ensure a homogeneous mixture and efficient integration of nanometer materials, improving tensile strength, compression, and chemical agents. This polymeric concrete is characterized by its versatility and sustainability, being applicable in sectors such as road infrastructure, sustainable construction, industrial environments, coastal structures and advanced architectures. In addition, the formulation thereof allows applications in paints, waterproofing agents, composite materials, decorative moulds, repairs, electronics, synthetic fibres, 3D printing and consumer goods, highlighting the adaptability thereof to different technical and industrial needs.

bcfa1d6ecf9c229db721df40c071467b3bc00354.title: MULTILAYER TEXTILE ASSEMBLIES FOR REVERSIBLE WATER VAPOR ABSORPTION
bcfa1d6ecf9c229db721df40c071467b3bc00354.abstract: Described herein are multilayer moisture management assemblies for reversible absorption of water vapor where the assemblies regulate relative humidity in microclimates proximate the assemblies. The moisture management assemblies absorb water vapor from air when the relative humidity level in the air is at or above a threshold level, thus retarding further elevation of the relative humidity. Articles incorporating the assemblies are also disclosed.

69c0ee3490f6da9571253a9f85fe63fa17971c8b.title: GRAPHENE OXIDE COMPOSITE MEMBRANES
69c0ee3490f6da9571253a9f85fe63fa17971c8b.abstract: A system involves interleaving high aspect ratio, rod-like aldehyde-modified cellulose nanomaterials (ACN) between graphene oxide (GO) sheets and utilizing crosslinkers to create a dense, crosslinked network that is highly permeable and selective to a molecule of interest, especially water and water vapor, and does not delaminate in water. This system, especially when combined with oxidative surface treatment of a membrane support substrate, leads to improved adhesion of the membrane on the substrate.

dfd9aff81606de3056f454beeea77f74aa47b5f7.title: FUEL CELL SYSTEM AND CONTROL METHOD OF FUEL CELL SYSTEM
dfd9aff81606de3056f454beeea77f74aa47b5f7.abstract: A control method of a fuel cell system according to the present disclosure uses a fuel cell system including a raw material supply system configured to supply a raw material, a water vapor supply system configured to supply water vapor to the raw material supply system, a fuel cell configured to generate electric energy from hydrogen generated from the raw material and an oxidizing agent, and a recycle gas system configured to circulate a recycle gas, which is at least a part of an anode off-gas discharged from an anode of the fuel cell, to the raw material supply system. A flow rate of water vapor flowing through the water vapor supply system is controlled in accordance with a flow rate of carbon dioxide contained in the recycle gas flowing through the recycle gas system.

ffd68f22962061889930ad6b1a861fb9d5354f15.title: LAYERED PRODUCT AND COMPOSITE LAYERED PRODUCT
ffd68f22962061889930ad6b1a861fb9d5354f15.abstract: A protective layered body including: a first substrate layer; and a first release layer disposed in contact with one surface or both surfaces of the first substrate layer, wherein the first substrate layer is a layer formed of a resin containing a polymer and having a water vapor transmission rate at 40° C. and 90% Rh of smaller than 1 g/m2/day when the first substrate layer is assumed to have a thickness of 100 μm. Also provided is a composite layered body including the protective layered body and a resin layer (R) disposed on the protective layered body to be in contact with a surface thereof on a side of the release layer, wherein, when the resin layer (R) is left to stand in an environment at 25° C. and 50% Rh for 2 hours, a weight change ratio of the resin layer (R) is 0.5% or more.

1c27b5224860aecac3ab017377db13597d1ab236.title: PAVING MEMBRANE
1c27b5224860aecac3ab017377db13597d1ab236.abstract: A paving membrane (1) includes a flexible plastic layer impermeable to water and water vapor (4) of the film-like plastic having a top side (5) and a bottom side (6) and an anchor layer (11) firmly attached to the bottom side (6) of the plastic layer (4). The plastic layer includes a plurality of buttons (7) present on the top side, each of the buttons forming a button cavity (8) on the bottom side. Water or water vapour discharge channels (9) are formed on the underside of the plastic layer (4). A maximum height (hmax) of the membrane (1) is at most about 5 mm, and at least 200 buttons per 10 cm2 are provided in areas having buttons (7).

c013bfa8674f32f81e9e17a432cb706ba0696cf5.title: CHAUDIÈRE À HYDROGÈNE ET DISPOSITIF DE GESTION
c013bfa8674f32f81e9e17a432cb706ba0696cf5.abstract: In a hydrogen boiler (3), hydrogen gas and oxygen gas supplied from a water electrolysis device (2), which generates the hydrogen gas and the oxygen gas by electrolyzing water, are combusted in a combustion chamber of the hydrogen boiler (3), and a water pipe of the hydrogen boiler (3) is heated, thus generating water vapor.

6dddfa172b520095c99ad8ac5971eb10f9469265.title: SYSTÈME DE PYROLYSE ET DE GAZÉIFICATION ET APPAREIL DE PRODUCTION DE GAZ DE SYNTHÈSE
6dddfa172b520095c99ad8ac5971eb10f9469265.abstract: Provided are a system and apparatus for pyrolysis and gasification of waste for synthesis gas production. In this waste gasification treatment apparatus in which waste is introduced into a reduction furnace and gasified, the reduction furnace comprises: a waste treatment space including an upper treatment space in which waste is gasified and which is located at an upper portion, a lower treatment space located at a lower portion, and a central treatment space separating the upper treatment space and the lower treatment space and having a diameter smaller than the diameter of the lower treatment space and the upper treatment space; a slag discharge unit through which slag is discharged from the lower end of the reduction furnace; a gas discharge unit through which gas is discharged from the upper end of the reduction furnace; a plurality of upper burners which supply oxygen to the upper treatment space; and a plurality of lower burners which supply oxygen and water vapor to the lower treatment space.

e9962540e3aff246e20059d1e715b518f899ac02.title: FILM MULTICOUCHE DÉPOSÉ EN PHASE VAPEUR, STRUCTURE MULTICOUCHE, MATÉRIAU D'EMBALLAGE, COMPOSITION DE RÉCUPÉRATION ET PROCÉDÉ DE RECYCLAGE
e9962540e3aff246e20059d1e715b518f899ac02.abstract: The present invention provides: a vapor-deposited multilayer film which has high oxygen barrier properties and high water vapor barrier properties, and has sufficient oxygen barrier properties even after a bending treatment; and the like. Provided is a vapor-deposited multilayer film comprising: a multilayer film in which a layer (A), as the outermost layer, a layer (B), and a layer (C) are stacked in this order; and a vapor-deposited inorganic layer (I) stacked on the exposed surface side of the layer (A). The vapor-deposited inorganic layer (I) is a vapor-deposited metal layer that is mainly composed of aluminum, or a vapor-deposited inorganic oxide layer that is mainly composed of alumina or silica. The layer (A) contains, as a main component, an ethylene-vinyl alcohol copolymer (a) that has an ethylene unit content of 36-60 mol%; the layer (B) contains, as a main component, an ethylene-vinyl alcohol copolymer (b) that has an ethylene unit content of 20-35 mol%; and the layer (C) contains a polyethylene or a polypropylene as a main component. The average thickness of the multilayer film is 300 µm or less.
e9962540e3aff246e20059d1e715b518f899ac02.system_message:

414c6830ed2351d7ef9cecb34741e41319adce4c.title: STRATIFIÉ FORMANT UNE BARRIÈRE AUX GAZ
414c6830ed2351d7ef9cecb34741e41319adce4c.abstract: This gas barrier laminate comprises: a paper substrate; and, in order on at least one surface of the paper substrate, an oxygen barrier layer and a water vapor barrier layer. The oxygen barrier layer contains a water-soluble resin and an inorganic compound having an aspect ratio of 50 or less and an average particle diameter of 3 μm or less; the water-soluble resin contains at least one selected from the group consisting of polyvinyl alcohols and modified polyvinyl alcohols having a saponification degree of 93% or more; the content of the inorganic compound is 150 to 540 parts by mass with respect to 100 parts by mass of the water-soluble resin; and the water vapor barrier layer contains a water dispersible resin.

bd42de83ec0fad40d2e2e4d95590e10ae99b20d6.title: PROCÉDÉ ET DISPOSITIF POUR LA FOURNITURE DE VAPEUR D'EAU À UNE CONDUITE DE REFOULEMENT PRIMAIRE
bd42de83ec0fad40d2e2e4d95590e10ae99b20d6.abstract: The present invention is a method for supplying water vapor to a foreline (12) when an exhaust gas (E) to be detoxified, which is discharged from a semiconductor fabrication process, is decomposed by a plasma source (14) provided in the foreline (12), characterized by supplying, to a location along the foreline (12) where the pressure is 400 Pa or less, water vapor generated by adjusting water (W) to a water temperature between 10°C and 35°C, inclusive.

0a4131e7f6159ff44cd9ac9f7da55a8589655315.title: DISPOSITIF D'ÉLIMINATION D'HUILE UTILISANT LA CHALEUR ET LA FORCE CENTRIFUGE
0a4131e7f6159ff44cd9ac9f7da55a8589655315.abstract: This oil removal device using heat and centrifugal force can efficiently remove oil by using heat and centrifugal force, and thus can improve the taste and texture of fried food. In addition, a plurality of baskets formed to have step differences are used to prevent fried food from clumping together, and oil is removed while discharging oil vapor and water vapor through an air vent, thereby making it possible to minimize the reabsorption of oil separated from fried food into other fried food.

639a83b8a3861e1f9b9b471190299e614fe125cf.title: MATÉRIAU D'EMBALLAGE EXTERNE POUR MATÉRIAU D'ISOLATION THERMIQUE SOUS VIDE, MATÉRIAU D'ISOLATION THERMIQUE SOUS VIDE, ARTICLE AVEC MATÉRIAU D'ISOLATION THERMIQUE SOUS VIDE, ET PROCÉDÉ DE PRODUCTION DE MATÉRIAU D'EMBALLAGE EXTERNE POUR MATÉRIAU D'ISOLATION THERMIQUE SOUS VIDE
639a83b8a3861e1f9b9b471190299e614fe125cf.abstract: The present disclosure provides an outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material, the outer packaging material having a water vapor permeability of 0.1 g/(m2·day) or less and an oxygen permeability of 0.1 cc/(m2·day·atm) or less. The outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material has a plane-direction thermal diffusivity α and a thickness T which satisfy the following (expression 1). Expression 1: α≤6.375×10-5/(T×V) (In the expression, α is the plane-direction thermal diffusivity (m2/s) of the outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material, T is the thickness (m) of the outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material, and V is the volumetric specific heat of the outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material and is 2.2×106 J/(m3·K) to 2.4×106 J/(m3·K).)

aae44b5a5b18e48452c316d0337941bc3167ed42.title: MULTI-FUNCTIONAL ANALGESIC-RELEASING WOUND DRESSING
aae44b5a5b18e48452c316d0337941bc3167ed42.abstract: A wound dressing including a porous biosynthetic polymer film comprising a poly(lactide-co-caprolactone) (“PLC”) copolymer or other suitable polymer matrix, and a local analgesic loaded therein, to provide pain relief over an extended period of time (e.g., for 5-7 days), e.g., for healing of a partial thickness dermal injury. The PLC copolymer may have a particular lactide/caprolactone molar ratio (e.g., from 2:1 to 9:1) to ensure slow, sustained release of the bupivacaine or other analgesic. The dressing may provide a water vapor transmission rate from 1000 g/m2·day to 3000 g/m2·day to facilitate fast healing and regrowth of new epithelial tissue beneath the dressing. The dressing is configured to remain positioned over the dermal injury, providing wound protection for about 14 days, after which is simply debrides away, falls off, or is easily and painlessly removed, once new epithelial tissue regrows.

dc21c0f516e01ad2961f77fa81641840015526db.title: Atmospheric correction
dc21c0f516e01ad2961f77fa81641840015526db.abstract: This disclosure relates to machine learning models for performing atmospheric correction on an input image. To train a machine learning model to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion, a processor applies a first trained machine learning model to a training image to determine a first output image, the first trained machine learning model being configured to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion. The processor applies a second machine learning model to the training image to determine a second output image, wherein the second machine learning model has a smaller model architecture than the first trained machine learning model. The processor trains the second machine learning model by minimising a loss based on the first output image and the second output image to determine a second trained machine learning model. This disclosure relates to machine learning models for performing atmospheric correction on an input image. To train a machine learning model to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion, a processor applies a first trained machine learning model to a training image to determine a first output image, the first trained machine learning model being configured to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion. The processor applies a second machine learning model to the training image to determine a second output image, wherein the second machine learning model has a smaller model architecture than the first trained machine learning model. cba7aa7cc22a38f7b9a3ab8991bdfb0c7aa78235.title: MATERIALS, MANUFACTURING METHOD AND DEVICE FOR CONVERTING AMBIENT HUMIDITY TO ELECTRICAL ENERGY AND USES THEREOF
cba7aa7cc22a38f7b9a3ab8991bdfb0c7aa78235.abstract: The present disclosure relates to a modular converter for continuous conversion of water vapor into electricity comprising: a porous matrix comprising compressed metal oxide nanopowder, wherein the porous matrix, is covered from first side by the functional layer, which partially may infuse in the porous matrix, preferably an aluminum phosphate; a layer of carbon electrode, preferably a layer of graphite on the active layer, metal or carbon current collectors on carbon electrode layer and layer of metal Au, Ag, Al, Cu, Fe, Zn, Mg, Li, Ni, Co, Ti, Zr, Sn, Cr, Y, Nb, Mo, Rd, Pt, Cd, Hf, Ta, W, C or their alloys. Schottky contact on the second side of the converter; and metal or carbon current collectors, on the layer of Schottky contact, wherein the second surface of the converter is directly opposite the first surface of the converter.

7c785a9d9f88be6061b78603ac9901c423d9785d.title: Smart industrial boiler exhaust gas circulation loop formation control device and method for three-effect type smart industrial boiler exhaust gas circulation loop formation control device for fine dust reduction water vapor evaporation and latent heat recycling
7c785a9d9f88be6061b78603ac9901c423d9785d.abstract: 본 발명에서는 기존 산업용 보일러 배기가스내 수증기의 경우에, 백연 발생, 오염물질 확산 방행, 2차 입자상 물질 생성 촉진, 에어로졸을 활성화시키는 문제점과, 보일러 배기가스의 경우에, 대기 중에 냉각되면서 응축시 미세먼지(PM2.5)를 생성시키는데, 이는 지름이 2.5㎛(마이크로미터, 1㎛=100만분의 1m) 이하인 초미세먼지로서, 크기가 작아 호흡기를 통해 폐와 혈관까지 침투하여 건강에 심각한 영향을 미치기 때문에, 탄소배출권 시장에서 권고하고, 미국 EPA (μg/m³) 기준 연평균 12 μg/m³ 이하로 생성시킬 수 있는 보일러 배기가스용 미세먼지 저감장치개발이 시급한 문제점을 개선하고자, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 모듈(100), 저온 배기열 회수 흡수탑모듈(200), 스마트 증류탑 순환루프 형성모듈(300), 시상수·응축수 탱크부(400), 스마트제어부(500)로 구성됨으로서, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 모듈을 통해, 현열과 잠열을 동시 회수하는 하이브리드 방식으로 적용하여, 기존보다 30~50% 이상의 배기열 회수 효율을 향상시킬 수 있고, 배기열 회수량이 증가함에 따라 보일러 연료 소모량을 20% 이상 절감시킬 수 있으며, 난방뿐만 아니라 냉방, 온수 공급까지 동시에 가능하여, 에너지원 활용의 범위를 넓힐 수 있고, 배기 가스 중 포함된 미세먼지(입자상물질, PM)와 수증기 응축이 용이하여, 탄소배출권 시장에도 미세먼지 저감장치로서 경쟁력있게 적용시킬 수 있고, 저온 배기열 회수 흡수탑모듈이 구성됨으로서, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 모듈과 연계하여 현열 + 잠열을 동시에 회수하는 방식을 적용함으로써, 기존보다 낮은 온도 20~40℃ 에서도 배기열을 회수시킬 수 있고, 흡수제 직접 분사로 노점온도 하강 및 배기열 손실 최소화시킬 수 있으며, 4단형 흡수탑 구조로 흡수 효율을 기존보다 80% 향상시킬 수 있고, 기존에는 흡수제의 재사용이 어려워 운영 비용이 높았으나, 본 발명에서는 흡수제 재생 시스템을 포함하여 흡수제의 지속적인 사용이 가능하므로 경제성이 뛰어난 효과가 있고, 스마트 증류탑 순환루프 형성모듈을 통해, 저온 배기열 회수 흡수탑모듈을 활용하여, 폐열을 회수하여 저농도 흡수제를 예열하고, 낮은 온도에서도 증발이 가능하도록 감압 분위기를 형성시켜, 기존 대비 기존 대비 30~50% 이상의 에너지 절감 효과를 기대할 수 있고, 감압 분위기 내에서 증발 촉진 및 증류 속도를 기존에 비해, 1.5배~2배 향상시킬 수 있으며, 농축 흡수제 냉각기와 농축 흡수제 가열기를 활용하여 적절한 온도로 순환시킴으로써, 흡수제의 성능 저하를 방지하고 흡수제의 사용 수명을 기존보다 1.5배~3배 길게 연장시킬 수 있고, 증발된 수증기의 응축수를 시상수·응축수 탱크부로 이동하여 재사용될 수 있어, 수자원 절약율을 기존에 비해 80% 향상시킬 수 있으며, 스마트제어부가 구성됨으로서, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 제어모드를 통해, 배기가스의 현열(150~120°C)과 잠열(40~20°C)을 동시에 회수하여 실내 난방 및 온수 공급에 재활용시킬 수 있고,단순히 공기를 데우는 것이 아니라, 배기열을 최대한 활용하여 냉난방 시스템의 에너지 효율을 기존에 비해 80% 향상시킬 수 있으며, 산업용 가스보일러의 백연 제거와 동시에 미세먼지(여과성+응축성)를 80% 이상 제거시킬 수 있고, 보일러 배기가스에 포함된 수분 제거율을 80% 이상 제거시킬 수 있는 미세먼지 저감·수증기 증발·잠열 재활용 쓰리이펙트형 스마트 산업용 보일러 배기가스 순환루프 형성제어장치 및 방법을 제공하는데 그 목적이 있다.

80d08d87258b825df253946231da1a2e2682c51b.title: SYSTÈMES ET PROCÉDÉS DE DÉSHYDRATANT THERMIQUE SOLAIRE À HAUT RENDEMENT
80d08d87258b825df253946231da1a2e2682c51b.abstract: A water generation system includes a housing having a surface to collect solar radiation; a sorption layer comprising a hygroscopic material to capture water vapor from a process gas during a sorption mode and release water vapor to a regeneration fluid during a desorption mode; and a thermally insulative transparent layer disposed above or upstream of the hygroscopic material to allow solar radiation to pass therethrough to the hygroscopic material and reduce thermal conductance from the hygroscopic material to the external environment. Generating water includes allowing solar radiation to pass through a thermally insulative transparent layer to a hygroscopic material; directing a regeneration fluid in a regeneration flow path to collect heat from the thermally insulative transparent layer and transfer collected heat to the hygroscopic material to release water vapor to the regeneration fluid; and condensing, via a heat exchange assembly, water vapor from the regeneration fluid.

0e3a10ffc27218a79eccc1469707176e45fcadf0.title: REVÊTEMENT COMPOSITE HYDROPHOBE/RÉSISTANT À LA CORROSION RICHE EN CHROME, SON PROCÉDÉ DE PRÉPARATION ET SON UTILISATION
0e3a10ffc27218a79eccc1469707176e45fcadf0.abstract: A hydrophobic/chromium-rich corrosion-resistant composite coating, a preparation method therefor, and the use thereof, relating to the technical field of material surface coatings. The preparation method comprises: preheating a workpiece; applying a coating slurry to the surface of the preheated workpiece, and performing drying and curing and sintering treatment to obtain a chromium-rich corrosion-resistant coating on the surface of the workpiece, the coating slurry comprising a solid-phase component and a liquid-phase component, wherein the solid-phase component comprises chromium powder, nickel powder, iron powder and a rare earth compound, and the liquid-phase component comprises Al(H2PO4)3, water glass, an ammonium halide, polyvinyl alcohol and Cr2O3; and spray-coating a layer of a superhydrophobic material on the surface of the chromium-rich corrosion-resistant coating, and then performing curing treatment to obtain the hydrophobic/chromium-rich corrosion-resistant composite coating. A workpiece undergoes chromizing treatment and superhydrophobic treatment and thus possesses corrosion resistance, wear resistance and hydrophobic properties, so that water vapor in tubes cannot stay on the inner walls of the tubes, thereby preventing corrosion of the inner walls of the tubes, improving the comprehensive performance of the tubes, and prolonging the service life.

9d31edc6f8d8672c0845871775a427e8302074c0.title: CARBON MATERIAL-COATED GRAPHITE PARTICLES, LITHIUM ION SECONDARY BATTERY NEGATIVE ELECTRODE, LITHIUM ION SECONDARY BATTERY, AND PRODUCTION METHOD FOR CARBON MATERIAL-COATED GRAPHITE PARTICLES
9d31edc6f8d8672c0845871775a427e8302074c0.abstract: Carbonaceous substance-coated graphite particles are disclosed that can be used as a negative electrode material for a lithium ion secondary battery. The carbonaceous substance-coated graphite particles include graphite particles and a carbonaceous substance covering at least part of surfaces of the graphite particles. A mass reduction starting temperature when the carbonaceous substance-coated graphite particles are heated in a water vapor atmosphere is 800° C. to 980° C., and a content of the carbonaceous substance is 0.1 to 15.0 parts by mass with respect to 100.0 parts by mass of the graphite particles.

be57db2408f5ca9107e0b233dd2ff949e2550621.title: WATER PRECIPITATING DEVICES, METHODS AND SYSTEMS
be57db2408f5ca9107e0b233dd2ff949e2550621.abstract: Provided herein are systems, devices and methods for generating water from ambient air, by implementing a water vapor separation unit, including one or more selective membranes, configured to selectively separate/transfer water vapor form the ambient air, and a water precipitation unit, including a plurality of cooling elements, configured for precipitating the selectively separated water vapor from the ambient air.

f0bbb7e77e76a8d2a01cb14ac72436a7a4a6943e.title: STOPPING METHOD FOR A SEPARATION DEVICE
f0bbb7e77e76a8d2a01cb14ac72436a7a4a6943e.abstract: A stopping method for a separation device is a stopping method for a separation device, which is to be performed after a dehydration step using a separation membrane, the separation device including the separation membrane, the stopping method including: placing the separation membrane under an environment A in which a water vapor partial pressure P(H2O) and a saturation water vapor pressure Psat(H2O) satisfy a relationship of [P(H2O)/Psat(H2O)≥0.001] and a temperature is 100° C. or higher; and decreasing a temperature of the environment A.

215d0a78ab7b926327e84baca7916b8c5b91c467.title: Water vapor permeable ribbed membranes and related systems and related methods
215d0a78ab7b926327e84baca7916b8c5b91c467.abstract: Water vapor permeable ribbed membranes and related methods are provided. A water vapor permeable ribbed membrane has a top surface and a bottom surface opposite the top surface. The water vapor permeable ribbed membrane comprises a plurality of ribs located on at least the bottom surface. An adhesive layer is located on the plurality of ribs. When the adhesive layer is adhered to a top surface of another water vapor permeable ribbed membrane, the adhesive layer has a peel adhesion of at least 1.5 lb/in, as measured according to ASTM D3330 (Method B). The water vapor permeable ribbed membrane has a water vapor permeability of greater than 10 perms, as measured according to ASTM E96B.

8e8aa31535a48cda750edb348e23701ebdd68b9c.title: DEVICE FOR SYNTHETIC GAS PRODUCTION
8e8aa31535a48cda750edb348e23701ebdd68b9c.abstract: Synthetic gas production device includes a bin 1 and heating section 2, which is disposed in combustion chamber and has diffusive part, which restricting area is directed to mixing chamber 7 and connected therewith passing pipe with diameter equal of said restricting area diameter. Mixing chamber 7 is executed in a form of truncated cone and disposed above gasification section. Raw bin is connected to mixing chamber with auger feeder 4. Water vapor feeding section 6 is disposed above gasification section, in mixing chamber area so, that together with raw mix and heat carrier feeding into gasification section the vapor feeding would be provided directly to said mix stream motion. Gasification section has diffusion part, as well, which restricting area is connected to a regenerator 8, having diffusive part connected to delivery mouth 10. Productional gas outlet means is connected to gasification section; furthermore, a device is equipped with a transporter 12 carring outgoing heat carrier-catalyst from device inner capacity through a lattice 11 into receving bin 1.

9c431e7f4ca9dbbf04b9b53aca7471e816f16f99.title: METHOD FOR SETTING AN OVEN ATMOSPHERE IN A HEAT-TREATMENT OVEN
9c431e7f4ca9dbbf04b9b53aca7471e816f16f99.abstract: A method of establishing a furnace atmosphere in a directly heated heat treatment furnace is provided. A heat treatment furnace has at least one burner which is operated with a fuel gas and an oxygenous gas that are combusted to give a combustion gas. The combustion gas has a defined composition having a defined partial water vapor pressure. Hydrogen is used in the fuel gas with a proportion of at least 10% by volume. The heat treatment furnace is additionally flooded with a water vapor-free and/or hydrogen-free gas, as a result of which the water vapor-free and/or hydrogen-free gas mixes with the combustion gas so as to bring about a partial water vapor pressure of the mixture in the furnace atmosphere of the heat treatment furnace that is less than the defined partial water vapor pressure of the combustion gas.
9c431e7f4ca9dbbf04b9b53aca7471e816f16f99.system_message:

74ff436f6dc72b4d2cf1d06bc6577fd2553adfe7.title: ATMOSPHERIC WATER GENERATOR SUPPLIED WITH PHOTOVOLTAIC SOLAR POWER
74ff436f6dc72b4d2cf1d06bc6577fd2553adfe7.abstract: A photovoltaic device, comprising: a photovoltaic generator whose electrical production power varies; an air humidifier device comprising: a storage compartment for atmospheric water vapor; means for heating and injecting the ambient air into the storage compartment; means for cooling and extracting the air flow available at the outlet of the storage compartment; an atmospheric water vapor condenser, which draws in the air flow previously humidified and cooled by the air humidifier device; a management module of the electrical power produced by the photovoltaic generator and used to electrically power the air humidifier device and the condenser device; said means for cooling and extracting the air flow being supplied with a variable electrical power controlled by the value of the surplus of photovoltaic electrical power available, from when the electrical power produced by the photovoltaic generator is greater than said electrical power used by the condenser.

2201251e5341d28a5faf72218772c782a1d43e28.title: DEVICE AND METHOD AND DEVICE FOR MOISTURE-CONTROLLED BLOW-OFF AFTER THE APPLICATION OF A LAYER ONTO A FLAT STEEL PRODUCT
2201251e5341d28a5faf72218772c782a1d43e28.abstract: A device and method for applying ZnAlMg layers or ZnAl layers to the front and rear side of a flat steel product, includes moving the flat steel product from an input side to an exit side of a zinc alloy melt bath, providing a dry gas stream, providing a water vapor gas, combining the dry gas stream and the water vapor gas to obtain a stripping gas as a mixture, determining the gas humidity of the stripping gas, discharging the stripping gas through at least one gas nozzle which serves to blow off the front side and through at least one gas nozzle which serves to blow off the back side in order to blow off the front side and rear side of the flat steel product with the stripping gas.

c4996f64ade43a84a7f3a32c68011c5d4e12baa9.title: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR APPLYING A LAYER ONTO A FLAT STEEL PRODUCT
c4996f64ade43a84a7f3a32c68011c5d4e12baa9.abstract: A device for applying a layer (to a front and/or rear side of a flat steel product includes a zinc alloy melt bath (11) (ZnAl; ZnAlMg) with an input side and an exit side, a stripping nozzle device with at least one gas nozzle for blowing off the front or rear side of the flat steel product with gas, the stripping nozzle device being arranged in the area of the exit side, and a water vapor device which is configured to emit gaseous water vapor and to provide a controlled water vapor atmosphere in the close range of the front and/or rear side of the flat steel product. The controlled water vapor atmosphere has an absolute local humidity which is greater than 1 g/m3 and less than 300 g/m3, the absolute local humidity preferably being in the range of 2.71 g/m3 to 50 g/m3.

1b8d0eda6f5b4de64c691219defcdd96271e6287.title: MOULE D'ESTAMPAGE À CHAUD DE PETIT LOT BASÉ SUR UN REFROIDISSEMENT PAR L'AIR DIRECTEMENT SUR LA SURFACE , ET PROCÉDÉ DE REFROIDISSEMENT
1b8d0eda6f5b4de64c691219defcdd96271e6287.abstract: A small-batch hot stamping mold based on direct surface air cooling, comprising a male mold (20) and a female mold (30), wherein a recess matching a punch of the male mold is provided on the female mold, a first cavity (21) recessed toward the interior of the male mold is provided on a surface of the male mold, a second cavity (31) recessed toward the interior of the female mold is further provided on a surface of the female mold, and the first cavity and the second cavity are configured to form an airflow cooling channel in communication with an external pipe; and water vapor introduced through the external pipe enters the mold, and circulates and exchanges heat in the airflow cooling channel formed by the first cavity and the second cavity and on the surface of the mold, so as to take away the heat from a stamped part and the surface of the mold. Further disclosed are a cooling method for a stamped part based on direct surface air cooling and a cooling method for a stamping mold based on direct surface air cooling. The stamping mold is provided with the cavities on the surface of the mold, the manufacturing cost and maintenance cost of the mold are low, and the production cost of a single piece is reduced.

9d836d232b953e215bf3559e32722b697a0ccb02.title: ADIABATIC WATER DESALINATION SYSTEM
9d836d232b953e215bf3559e32722b697a0ccb02.abstract: Methods and systems are disclosed for easy and cost-effective adiabatic water desalination, producing freshwater and/or potable water from saline sources with minimal energy input. This is achieved by utilizing adiabatic thermodynamic processes to reduce energy consumption compared to conventional methods. The disclosed methods and systems offer sustainable and cost-effective solutions to address freshwater scarcity. In an example of these methods, a saltwater tank with two chambers is rocked back and forth around an axis such that, during each half cycle of rocking, the vapor volume of one chamber expands and the vapor volume of the other chamber shrinks. The expansion of the chambers' vapor volume vaporizes the salt water, and the shrinkage of the chambers' vapor volume causes condensation of the water vapor, which will be collected in a separate tank.

0c681fcfac7189fd190ca66f5024f86a43bf6359.title: INSTALLATION AND METHOD FOR CONVERTING URANIUM HEXAFLUORIDE TO URANIUM DIOXIDE
0c681fcfac7189fd190ca66f5024f86a43bf6359.abstract: An installation for the conversion of uranium hexafluoride (UF6) to uranium dioxide (UO2) comprises a hydrolysis reactor (4) for the conversion of UF6 into uranium oxyfluoride powder (UO2F2), a pyrohydrolysis furnace (6) for converting the UO2F2 powder supplied by the reactor (4) into UO2 powder, a supply device (8) comprising reagent injection ducts (10) for the injection of UF6, water vapor or H2, and a control system (16) designed to control the supply device (8) so as to supply at least one of the reagent injection ducts (10) with a neutral gas during a shut-down or start-up phase of the conversion installation.

ffe1586d3676ca8d7a2b5c1105edb2b5732167bf.title: Graphene preparation system and method
ffe1586d3676ca8d7a2b5c1105edb2b5732167bf.abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of graphene preparation, and provides a graphene preparation system and method.The system comprises a gas supply device, a plasma synthesis device, a gas-solid separation device, a product collection device, a tail gas separation device and a hydrogen storage device. The invention relates to a graphene preparation method, which comprises the following steps: ionizing a medium gas to generate plasma, and introducing a reaction gas to carry out a synthesis reaction; separating the reacted gas from a reaction product; settling and collecting the obtained reaction product; separating the obtained gas into hydrogen, medium gas and reaction gas; the medium gas and the reaction gas are recycled after being compressed, and the separated hydrogen is purified and stored. According to the technical scheme, the production cost is reduced, the material handling capacity is large, the productivity is high, the method is suitable for industrial application, energy consumption is low, pollution is avoided, expandability is high, and the application range is wide.

b5abeedf85061a5be0130d5006434629241a6dcd.title: Vacuum multi-layer heat insulation liquid hydrogen container and using method
b5abeedf85061a5be0130d5006434629241a6dcd.abstract: The invention discloses a vacuum multi-layer heat insulation liquid hydrogen container and a using method, the vacuum multi-layer heat insulation liquid hydrogen container comprises a liquid hydrogen storage tank outer tank and a liquid hydrogen storage tank inner tank located in the liquid hydrogen storage tank outer tank, and a nitrogen heat insulation structure, a methane gas heat insulation structure, a carbon dioxide heat insulation structure and a radiation heat insulation structure are sequentially arranged between the liquid hydrogen storage tank outer tank and the liquid hydrogen storage tank inner tank from inside to outside. According to the liquid hydrogen storage tank, efficient heat insulation of the liquid hydrogen storage tank and gradient utilization of the evaporation gas cooling capacity are comprehensively achieved through the liquid hydrogen evaporation gas cooling capacity and the multiple heat insulation layers internally filled with gas with different freezing point temperatures, meanwhile, the different heat insulation layers are isolated from one another, and the problem that the vacuum degree of a traditional liquid hydrogen storage tank is prone to damage is solved. The functions of the nitrogen heat insulation layer, the methane gas heat insulation layer, the carbon dioxide heat insulation layer and the radiation heat insulation layer can be regulated and controlled through corresponding valves, so that the liquid hydrogen storage tank has heat insulation regulation capacity, application scenes with different evaporation rate requirements can be effectively met, and emergency discharge of a hydrogen medium in the liquid hydrogen storage tank is achieved in some specific scenes.

db3c5f57e2558d7fb9138246c9608256eec0be95.title: Safety monitoring method and equipment of vehicle-mounted hydrogen storage system and storage medium
db3c5f57e2558d7fb9138246c9608256eec0be95.abstract: The invention discloses a safety monitoring method and equipment of a vehicle-mounted hydrogen storage system and a storage medium, the vehicle-mounted hydrogen storage system comprises a hydrogen in-pile stop valve, a hydrogen discharge valve, a hydrogen storage bottle, a pressure reducing valve and a hydrogen medium-pressure sensor, and the hydrogen medium-pressure sensor, the pressure reducing valve and the hydrogen in-pile stop valve are sequentially arranged on a pipeline between the hydrogen storage bottle and a fuel cell stack; the method comprises the following steps: acquiring a first opening and closing state of a hydrogen inlet pile stop valve, a second opening and closing state of the hydrogen discharge valve and medium-pressure pressure detected by a hydrogen medium-pressure sensor; determining a fault level threshold according to the first opening and closing state and the second opening and closing state; and determining the fault level of the medium-pressure pressure according to the medium-pressure pressure and the fault level threshold. The fault level is judged by combining the opening and closing states of the hydrogen reactor inlet stop valve and the hydrogen discharge valve, so that the misjudgment and false alarm of the medium-pressure pressure fault under different operation conditions can be effectively avoided, and the accuracy of safety monitoring is improved.

5c9c4b77a43d0188890af209465e51d8382b28b8.title: Liquid hydrogen conveying centrifugal pump
5c9c4b77a43d0188890af209465e51d8382b28b8.abstract: The invention discloses a liquid hydrogen conveying centrifugal pump which comprises a rotor assembly, an inner shell assembly and an outer shell assembly. The rotor assembly is sleeved in the inner shell assembly to form a core; and the core is sleeved in the outer shell assembly. A multi-stage centrifugal pump structure is adopted for conveying a liquid hydrogen medium, and a three-stage centrifugal wheel with long blades, middle blades and short blades, a radial inlet annular inlet shell, a combined inter-stage overflowing structure with radial guide blades and reverse guide blades and a combined sealing structure with static sealing, end face sealing and blow-off isolation sealing are adopted. By adopting a mounting mode which is compact in structure and convenient to disassemble, the liquid hydrogen medium can be transferred from an offshore transport ship to a storage tank, from the storage tank to the storage tank, from the storage tank to a tank car and the like; the whole structure is simple, and disassembly, assembly, disassembly and replacement are convenient; and the technical blank is filled.

a09a9ae07cbeb9f5ad652afe780cf2561a7f775f.title: Fuel cell hydrogen medium pressure control method, system and device
a09a9ae07cbeb9f5ad652afe780cf2561a7f775f.abstract: The invention relates to the technical field of fuel cell control, and particularly provides a fuel cell hydrogen medium pressure control method, system and device.The method comprises the steps that a current hydrogen medium pressure fluctuation value of a hydrogen system in the hydrogen discharging process is obtained; and under the condition that the current hydrogen medium pressure fluctuation value does not meet the preset condition, the hydrogen supply hydrogen pressure in the hydrogen system is controlled. According to the fuel cell hydrogen medium-pressure control method, after the opening degree of the electric control pressure reducing valve is controlled by using the electric signal, three-valve linkage is carried out between the hydrogen discharging electromagnetic valve and the hydrogen inlet proportional valve based on the pressure reducing valve and the hydrogen system, so that the hydrogen system can adaptively control and reduce hydrogen medium-pressure fluctuation through the opening degree of the pressure reducing valve; therefore, the stable control of the medium pressure of the hydrogen in the hydrogen discharging process of the fuel cell is better realized.

791bc1821dce2890d8945031a7d747213c841310.title: Liquid hydrogen low-temperature stop valve
791bc1821dce2890d8945031a7d747213c841310.abstract: The utility model relates to the technical field of valves, in particular to a liquid hydrogen low-temperature stop valve which comprises a valve body, a valve clack and a valve rod connected with the valve clack, a medium channel is arranged in the valve body, the valve body is connected with a valve cover, the liquid hydrogen low-temperature stop valve further comprises a vacuum jacket arranged on the outer side of the valve body, and a flange plate extends from one end, close to the valve cover, of the valve body. One end of the vacuum jacket is connected with the flange plate, the other end of the vacuum jacket is connected with the outer wall, corresponding to the medium channel, of the valve body, a vacuum cavity is formed between the vacuum jacket and the valve body, and a first screw plug communicated with the vacuum cavity is arranged at the end, close to the medium channel, of the vacuum jacket. The outer side of the valve body is connected with the vacuum jacket, so that a vacuum state is formed between the vacuum jacket and the valve body, heat exchange between the outer wall of the valve and air is reduced to the maximum extent, heat loss is fully reduced, cooling time is shortened, and a liquid hydrogen medium can be stably conveyed at low temperature.

6c8be9aa7e54a69987e7db2276b8656a879e4351.title: Normal pressure storage tank for storing liquid hydrogen
6c8be9aa7e54a69987e7db2276b8656a879e4351.abstract: The invention provides a normal pressure storage tank for liquid hydrogen storage. The normal pressure storage tank comprises an inner tank made of metal and used for containing a low-temperature liquid hydrogen medium, an outer tank located outside the inner tank and made of metal, a heat insulation interlayer located in an interlayer between the inner tank and the outer tank and playing a heat insulation role, and a cold shield arranged in the heat insulation interlayer. The cold shield comprises a cold shield coil pipe which is made of a metal material and is coiled in the heat insulation interlayer, the inlet end of the cold shield coil pipe is connected with a boil-off gas outlet of the gas phase space at the top of the inner tank, and the outlet end of the cold shield coil pipe penetrates through the outer tank, extends out of the outer tank and is connected with a boil-off gas recovery device. The cold shield medium entering the cold shield is the liquid hydrogen evaporation gas in the inner tank, the defect that the daily evaporation rate of the liquid hydrogen low-temperature normal-pressure storage technology is high can be overcome without introducing an external cold source, and the operation cost of the normal-pressure storage tank is reduced.

728fea67b731f796446a3543fc8186a41f73ed05.title: Gaseous hydrogen medium-pressure direct injection nozzle cap
728fea67b731f796446a3543fc8186a41f73ed05.abstract: The utility model discloses a gaseous hydrogen medium-pressure direct injection nozzle cap which comprises an expansion section, a compression section and a transition section connected with the expansion section and the compression section, and an inner cavity which becomes larger and smaller from top to bottom is formed. Wherein the expansion section is connected to the upper end of the transition section, and the joint between the expansion section and the transition section is of a gradually open structure, so that the flow area is increased; the upper end of the compression section is connected to the lower end of the transition section, and the flow area is gradually reduced from top to bottom; the transition section is equal in diameter, so that the diameter of the outlet of the expansion section is equal to that of the outlet of the transition section and is d. The nozzle cap has the advantages of simple structure, capability of effectively reducing the downstream hydrogen flow rate of the nozzle cap and reducing the impact of hydrogen on the wall surface of a cylinder sleeve, and the like.

dfc41ce92a09f687057dcbaa2fac770142e83a11.title: Preparation method of high-molecular rubber sealing product with high-pressure hydrogen permeation resistance
dfc41ce92a09f687057dcbaa2fac770142e83a11.abstract: The invention discloses a preparation method of a polymer rubber sealing product with high-pressure hydrogen permeation resistance, and relates to the technical field of rubber sealing, and the preparation method comprises the following steps: S1, obtaining plasticated rubber; s2, obtaining a rubber compound; and S3, putting the rubber compound obtained in the step S2 on a vulcanizing machine for pre-vulcanization, and performing thin passing for three times and secondary vulcanization to obtain the rubber material, the polymer rubber sealing product with high-pressure hydrogen permeation resistance can be applied to various industrial fields, and particularly plays an important role in high-temperature and high-pressure occasions. In the field of hydrogen energy, hydrogen is extremely small in molecule, high in activity and easy to permeate into a plurality of materials, so that preparation raw materials of the rubber sealing product are greatly improved and the dosage is optimized, and the prepared rubber sealing product not only has excellent chemical resistance and high-temperature resistance, but also has excellent mechanical property and high-temperature resistance. And in a high-pressure hydrogen medium environment, the composite material also has good airtight performance and high-pressure hydrogen permeation resistance.
